The PCL6-PHO85 cyclin-CDK holoenzyme has GLC8 kinase activity and phosphorylates and inactivates the phosphatase PP1-2 inhibitor GLC8, causing activation of PP1-2, which then dephosphorylates and activates glycogen phosphorylase. PCL6-PHO85 also phosphorylates YJL084C. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11602261, ECO:0000269|PubMed:11864988, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12098764, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12407105, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15721288}.

Entry.Name: THO1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Unknown; suppressor of the transcriptional defect of HPR1 by overexpression.

Entry.Name: RGI1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in the control of energetic metabolism and significantly contribute to cell fitness, especially under respiratory growth conditions. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20567505}.

Entry.Name: ICP55_YEAST
Protein.names: Intermediate cleaving peptidase 55 (EC 3.4.11.26) (Intermediate cleaving peptidase of 55 kDa)
Functions: FUNCTION: Aminopeptidase which cleaves preprotein intermediates that carry destabilizing N-ter amino acid residues after the mitochondrial processing peptidase (MPP) cleavage site and is thus critical for stabilization of the mitochondrial proteome. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19720832, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19837041}.

Entry.Name: TMN3_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: With EMP70 and TMN2, plays a critical role in the late stages of a nutrient-controlled pathway notably regulating FLO11 gene expression. Acts downstream of RAS2 and TOR. Essential for cell adhesion and filamentous growth. May play a role as effector of cellular copper homeostasis. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:18178563, ECO:0000269|PubMed:20681974}.

Entry.Name: AVT6_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in amino acid efflux from the vacuole to the cytoplasm. Capable of transporting aspartate and glutamate. Requires ATP for function. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11274162}.

Entry.Name: DSE1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in cell wall metabolism and required for the separation of the mother and daughter cells. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11309124}.

Entry.Name: LCP5_YEAST
Protein.names: U3 small nucleolar ribonucleoprotein protein LCP5
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the U3 small nucleolar ribonucleoprotein. Required for the early cleavages at sites A0, A1 and A2 of the pre-ribosomal RNA. Participates in ribosome biogenesis.

Entry.Name: VFA1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: VPS4-associated protein involved in trafficking to the vacuole. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21777356}.

Entry.Name: TAPT1_YEAST
Protein.names: Endoplasmic reticulum membrane protein 65 (65 kDa endoplasmic reticulum membrane protein)
Functions: FUNCTION: May be involved in membrane protein folding. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19325107}.

Entry.Name: FTR1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Permease for high affinity iron uptake.

Entry.Name: SPI1_YEAST
Protein.names: Uncharacterized cell wall protein SPI1 (Stationary phase-induced protein 1)
Functions: FUNCTION: Cell wall protein that plays a role in adaptation and resistance to cell wall stress. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16980434}.

Entry.Name: FTHC_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Only enzyme known to utilize 5-formyltetrahydrofolate (folinic acid) as substrate. Contributes to tetrahydrofolate metabolism in an alternative way of folate biosynthesis. May regulate carbon flow through the folate-dependent one-carbon metabolic network that supplies carbon for the biosynthesis of purines, thymidine and amino acids. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11923304}.

Entry.Name: YRF12_YEAST
Protein.names: Y' element ATP-dependent helicase protein 1 copy 2 (EC 3.6.4.12)
Functions: FUNCTION: Catalyzes DNA unwinding and is involved in telomerase-independent telomere maintenance. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:9837911}.

Entry.Name: WRIP1_YEAST
Protein.names: DNA-dependent ATPase MGS1 (Maintenance of genome stability protein 1)
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in the maintenance of proper DNA topology and chromosome integrity via annealing of single-stranded DNA breaks. Modulates DNA polymerase delta during replication or replication-associated repair. May function as a modulator for SGS1 when DNA is damaged. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11301316, ECO:0000269|PubMed:11459965, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12436259}.

Entry.Name: IES2_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the INO80 complex which remodels chromatin by shifting nucleosomes and is involved in DNA repair.

Entry.Name: NNRE_YEAST
Protein.names: NAD(P)H-hydrate epimerase (EC 5.1.99.6) (NAD(P)HX epimerase) (Nicotinamide nucleotide repair protein 1)
Functions: FUNCTION: Catalyzes the epimerization of the S- and R-forms of NAD(P)HX, a damaged form of NAD(P)H that is a result of enzymatic or heat-dependent hydration. This is a prerequisite for the S-specific NAD(P)H-hydrate dehydratase to allow the repair of both epimers of NAD(P)HX. {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03159, ECO:0000269|PubMed:21994945}.

Entry.Name: YNT4_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in sporulation and affects the sphingolipid composition of the plasma membrane. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11784867}.

Entry.Name: MMF1_YEAST
Protein.names: Protein MMF1, mitochondrial (Isoleucine biosynthesis and maintenance of intact mitochondria 1) (Maintenance of mitochondrial function 1)
Functions: FUNCTION: Plays a role in the maintenance of mitochondrial DNA.

Entry.Name: ERG29_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Part of the third module of ergosterol biosynthesis pathway that includes the late steps of the pathway (PubMed:23892078). ERG29 regulates the activity of the iron-containing C4-methylsterol oxidase ERG25 (PubMed:23892078). The third module or late pathway involves the ergosterol synthesis itself through consecutive reactions that mainly occur in the endoplasmic reticulum (ER) membrane. Firstly, the squalene synthase ERG9 catalyzes the condensation of 2 farnesyl pyrophosphate moieties to form squalene, which is the precursor of all steroids. Squalene synthase is crucial for balancing the incorporation of farnesyl diphosphate (FPP) into sterol and nonsterol isoprene synthesis. Secondly, the squalene epoxidase ERG1 catalyzes the stereospecific oxidation of squalene to (S)-2,3-epoxysqualene, which is considered to be a rate-limiting enzyme in steroid biosynthesis. Then, the lanosterol synthase ERG7 catalyzes the cyclization of (S)-2,3 oxidosqualene to lanosterol, a reaction that forms the sterol core. In the next steps, lanosterol is transformed to zymosterol through a complex process involving various demethylation, reduction and desaturation reactions. The lanosterol 14-alpha-demethylase ERG11 (also known as CYP51) catalyzes C14-demethylation of lanosterol to produce 4,4'-dimethyl cholesta-8,14,24-triene-3-beta-ol, which is critical for ergosterol biosynthesis. The C-14 reductase ERG24 reduces the C14=C15 double bond of 4,4-dimethyl-cholesta-8,14,24-trienol to produce 4,4-dimethyl-cholesta-8,24-dienol. 4,4-dimethyl-cholesta-8,24-dienol is substrate of the C-4 demethylation complex ERG25-ERG26-ERG27 in which ERG25 catalyzes the three-step monooxygenation required for the demethylation of 4,4-dimethyl and 4alpha-methylsterols, ERG26 catalyzes the oxidative decarboxylation that results in a reduction of the 3-beta-hydroxy group at the C-3 carbon to an oxo group, and ERG27 is responsible for the reduction of the keto group on the C-3. ERG28 has a role as a scaffold to help anchor ERG25, ERG26 and ERG27 to the endoplasmic reticulum and ERG29 regulates the activity of the iron-containing C4-methylsterol oxidase ERG25. Then, the sterol 24-C-methyltransferase ERG6 catalyzes the methyl transfer from S-adenosyl-methionine to the C-24 of zymosterol to form fecosterol. The C-8 sterol isomerase ERG2 catalyzes the reaction which results in unsaturation at C-7 in the B ring of sterols and thus converts fecosterol to episterol. The sterol-C5-desaturase ERG3 then catalyzes the introduction of a C-5 double bond in the B ring to produce 5-dehydroepisterol. The C-22 sterol desaturase ERG5 further converts 5-dehydroepisterol into ergosta-5,7,22,24(28)-tetraen-3beta-ol by forming the C-22(23) double bond in the sterol side chain. Finally, ergosta-5,7,22,24(28)-tetraen-3beta-ol is substrate of the C-24(28) sterol reductase ERG4 to produce ergosterol (PubMed:32679672). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:23892078, ECO:0000303|PubMed:32679672}.; FUNCTION: Plays a role in maintaining mitochondrial and plasma membrane integrity and consequently impacting the iron homeostasis, respiratory metabolism and antioxidant response (PubMed:9180083, PubMed:16135527, PubMed:16630279, PubMed:23892078, PubMed:29773647). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16135527, ECO:0000269|PubMed:16630279, ECO:0000269|PubMed:23892078, ECO:0000269|PubMed:29773647, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9180083}.

Entry.Name: RL13B_YEAST
Protein.names: Large ribosomal subunit protein eL13B (60S ribosomal protein L13-B)
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the ribosome, a large ribonucleoprotein complex responsible for the synthesis of proteins in the cell. The small ribosomal subunit (SSU) binds messenger RNAs (mRNAs) and translates the encoded message by selecting cognate aminoacyl-transfer RNA (tRNA) molecules. The large subunit (LSU) contains the ribosomal catalytic site termed the peptidyl transferase center (PTC), which catalyzes the formation of peptide bonds, thereby polymerizing the amino acids delivered by tRNAs into a polypeptide chain. The nascent polypeptides leave the ribosome through a tunnel in the LSU and interact with protein factors that function in enzymatic processing, targeting, and the membrane insertion of nascent chains at the exit of the ribosomal tunnel. {ECO:0000305|PubMed:22096102}.

Entry.Name: MEP1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Transporter for ammonium (both charged and uncharged NH3 and NH4) to use as a nitrogen source. Can also transport methylamine. The affinity of MEP1 is about twenty times lower than that of MEP2. MEP3 has the lowest affinity. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11486013, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9234685}.

Entry.Name: TOK1_YEAST
Protein.names: Outward-rectifier potassium channel TOK1 (Two-domain outward rectifier K(+) channel YORK)
Functions: FUNCTION: Outwardly rectifying potassium channel. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:18407956, ECO:0000269|PubMed:7651518}.

Entry.Name: CYB5_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Membrane bound hemoprotein which function as an electron carrier for several membrane bound oxygenases. It plays a role in fatty-acid desaturation and is also involved in several steps of the sterol biosynthesis pathway, particularly in the 4-demethylation of the 4,4'-dimethyl zymosterol.

Entry.Name: NACB2_YEAST
Protein.names: Nascent polypeptide-associated complex subunit beta-2 (NAC-beta-2) (BTF3 homolog BTT1) (Beta-2-NAC)
Functions: FUNCTION: Acts as component of the nascent polypeptide-associated complex (NAC), which promotes mitochondrial protein import by enhancing productive ribosome interactions with the outer mitochondrial membrane. Also blocks the inappropriate interaction of ribosomes translating non-secretory nascent polypeptides with translocation sites in the membrane of the endoplasmic reticulum. BTT1 may act as a transcription factor that exert a negative effect on the expression of several genes that are transcribed by RNA polymerase II. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10219998}.

Entry.Name: ALG8_YEAST
Protein.names: Dolichyl pyrophosphate Glc1Man9GlcNAc2 alpha-1,3-glucosyltransferase (EC 2.4.1.265) (Asparagine-linked glycosylation protein 8) (Dolichyl-P-Glc:Glc1Man9GlcNAc2-PP-dolichyl alpha-1,3-glucosyltransferase) (Dolichyl-P-Glc:Glc1Man9GlcNAc2-PP-dolichyl glucosyltransferase)
Functions: FUNCTION: Adds the second glucose residue to the lipid-linked oligosaccharide precursor for N-linked glycosylation. Transfers glucose from dolichyl phosphate glucose (Dol-P-Glc) onto the lipid-linked oligosaccharide Glc(1)Man(9)GlcNAc(2)-PP-Dol. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:3536907}.

Entry.Name: NTA1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Deamidates N-terminal Asn and Gln. Component of a targeting complex in the N-end rule pathway.

Entry.Name: SFGH_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Serine hydrolase involved in the detoxification of formaldehyde. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10427036}.

Entry.Name: DLS1_YEAST
Protein.names: Protein DLS1 (DPB3-like subunit of ISW2 complex 1)
Functions: FUNCTION: Functions as component of the ISW2 complex, which acts in remodeling the chromatin by catalyzing an ATP-dependent alteration in the structure of nucleosomal DNA. The ISW2 complex is involved in coordinating transcriptional repression and in inheritance of telomeric silencing. It is involved in repression of MAT a-specific genes, INO1, and early meiotic genes during mitotic growth dependent upon transcription factor UME6 and in a parallel pathway to the RPD3-SIN3 histone deacetylase complex. DLS1 is partially required for the ISW2 complex chromatin remodeling activity and is not required for its interaction with chromatin. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11081629, ECO:0000269|PubMed:11238944, ECO:0000269|PubMed:11489850, ECO:0000269|PubMed:11533234, ECO:0000269|PubMed:14673157, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15024052}.

Entry.Name: TCPE_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Molecular chaperone; assists the folding of proteins upon ATP hydrolysis. Known to play a role, in vitro, in the folding of actin and tubulin. In yeast may play a role in mitotic spindle formation.

Entry.Name: 6P21_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Synthesis of fructose 2,6-bisphosphate.

Entry.Name: CSS1_YEAST
Protein.names: Secreted protein CSS1 (Condition specific secretion protein 1) (Haze protective factor 1')
Functions: FUNCTION: Secreted protein that may be involved in cell wall organization and biosynthesis. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17024473}.

Entry.Name: COA1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Required for efficient assembly of cytochrome c oxidase in the mitochondrial inner membrane. Involved in a step coupling MSS51-dependent cotranslational insertion of COX1 to the addition of its heme A and copper B cofactors. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17882259, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17882260}.

Entry.Name: PANC_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Required for pantothenic acid biosynthesis. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11154694}.

Entry.Name: ASG1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Probable transcription factor involved in the stress response. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11353088}.

Entry.Name: TAO3_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Seems to play a role in cell morphogenesis. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11854408}.

Entry.Name: POG1_YEAST
Protein.names: Transcriptional activator POG1 (Promoter of growth protein 1)
Functions: FUNCTION: Transcriptional activator which promotes cell cycle recovery with CLN2, after pheromone induced G1 arrest, probably inhibiting the ability of STE20 to activate the pheromone response pathway. Binds the promoters of genes that function in cell cycle regulation, cytoskeletal organization, and spindle assembly. May also be involved in stress-resistance. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12464632, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17986087, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9927449}.

Entry.Name: QDR2_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Multidrug resistance transporter involved in resistance and adaptation to quinidine and to the herbicide barban (4-chloro-2-butynyl [3-chlorophenyl] carbamate). Implicated in potassium uptake. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15215105, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17189489}.

Entry.Name: QDR1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Multidrug resistance transporter involved in resistance and adaptation to quinidine and ketoconazole. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11302822}.

Entry.Name: HOS4_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Unknown. Component of the Set3C complex, which is required to repress early/middle sporulation genes during meiosis.

Entry.Name: HPM1_YEAST
Protein.names: Histidine protein methyltransferase 1 (EC 2.1.1.85) (Mitotic exit network interactor 1)
Functions: FUNCTION: Protein-histidine N-methyltransferase that mediates methylation of RPL3 at 'His-243' (PubMed:20864530, PubMed:24865971). Methylates ribosome-associated RPL3, but not free RPL3, thereby regulating 60S subunit assembly (PubMed:24865971, PubMed:26826131). In addition to RPL3, mediates His methylation of other proteins (PubMed:26826131). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20864530, ECO:0000269|PubMed:24865971, ECO:0000269|PubMed:26826131}.

Entry.Name: SHQ1_YEAST
Protein.names: Protein SHQ1 (Small nucleolar RNAs of the box H/ACA family quantitative accumulation protein 1)
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in the early biogenesis steps of box H/ACA snoRNP assembly. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12228251}.

Entry.Name: XBP1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Transcriptional repressor which binds to the consensus sequence 5'-GCCTCGA[G/A]G[C/A]-3'. Represses CLN1 transcription. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:9343412}.

Entry.Name: BMT5_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: S-adenosyl-L-methionine-dependent methyltransferase that specifically methylates the N(3) position of uridine 2634 (m3U2634) in 25S rRNA. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24335083}.

Entry.Name: ICE2_YEAST
Protein.names: Protein ICE2 (Inheritance of cortical ER protein 2)
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: KTR7_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Possible glycosyltransferase that transfers an alpha-D-mannosyl residue from GDP-mannose into lipid-linked oligosaccharide, forming an alpha-(1->2)-D-mannosyl-D-mannose linkage.

Entry.Name: CSN11_YEAST
Protein.names: Cop9 signalosome complex subunit 11 (Proteasome-COP9 signalosome-eIF3 domain protein 8)
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the COP9 signalosome (CSN) complex that acts as an regulator of the ubiquitin (Ubl) conjugation pathway by mediating the deneddylation of the cullin subunit of SCF-type E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase complexes The CSN complex is involved in the regulation of the mating pheromone response. PCI8 may also be involved in transcriptional and translational control. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11457827, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12186635, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12446563}.

Entry.Name: EFM4_YEAST
Protein.names: Protein-lysine N-methyltransferase EFM4 (EC 2.1.1.-) (Elongation factor methyltransferase 4) (Secretion and early endocytosis protein 1)
Functions: FUNCTION: S-adenosyl-L-methionine-dependent protein-lysine N-methyltransferase that mono- and dimethylates elongation factor 1-alpha (TEF1 and TEF2) at 'Lys-316'. May play a role in intracellular transport. {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03188, ECO:0000269|PubMed:20510667, ECO:0000269|PubMed:22522802, ECO:0000269|PubMed:24517342}.

Entry.Name: ARPC5_YEAST
Protein.names: Actin-related protein 2/3 complex subunit 5 (Arp2/3 complex 16 kDa subunit) (p16-ARC)
Functions: FUNCTION: Functions as component of the Arp2/3 complex which is involved in regulation of actin polymerization and together with an activating nucleation-promoting factor (NPF) mediates the formation of branched actin networks. {ECO:0000250}.

Entry.Name: VHR1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Transcription factor that binds to the VHRE consensus sequence in promoters of VHT1 and BIO5, and regulates their biotin-dependent expression. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16533810}.

Entry.Name: SYG1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: May function in G-protein coupled signal transduction. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:7592711}.

Entry.Name: APQ12_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in the regulation of lipid homeostasis in the endoplasmic reticulum, thereby impacting nuclear pore complex biogenesis and localization, and nucleocytoplasmic mRNA transport. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15273328, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17724120, ECO:0000269|PubMed:20016074}.

Entry.Name: ULP2_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Insertion mutation in SMT4 confers temperature and benomyl sensitivity; high copy suppressor of a temperature sensitive mutation in MIF2.

Entry.Name: VID28_YEAST
Protein.names: Vacuolar import and degradation protein 28 (Glucose-induced degradation protein 5)
Functions: FUNCTION: Required for the adaptation to the presence of glucose in the growth medium; mediates the degradation of enzymes involved in gluconeogenesis when cells are shifted to glucose-containing medium (PubMed:12686616). Required for proteasome-dependent catabolite degradation of fructose-1,6-bisphosphatase (FBP1) (PubMed:12686616). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12686616}.

Entry.Name: MNT3_YEAST
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: PDR11_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Transporter involved in the uptake of sterol. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12077145}.

Entry.Name: TIR3_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the cell wall. Required for anaerobic growth. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11292809}.

Entry.Name: PSMD9_YEAST
Protein.names: Probable 26S proteasome regulatory subunit p27 (Proteasome non-ATPase subunit 2)
Functions: FUNCTION: Acts as a chaperone during the assembly of the 26S proteasome, specifically of the base subcomplex of the 19S regulatory complex (RC). During the base subcomplex assembly is part of a NAS2:RPT4:RPT5 module; NAS2 is released during the further base assembly process. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19446322}.

Entry.Name: EGH1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Ergosteryl beta-glucosidase involved in the ergosteryl beta-glucoside (EG) catabolic pathway and vacuole formation via hydrolysis of EG to generate glucose (PubMed:26116408). Is also able to hydrolyze cholesteryl beta-glucoside and sitosteryl beta-glucoside to generate glucose; and C6-7-nitro-2,1,3-benzoxadiazole (NBD)-GlcCer to generate C6-NBD-ceramide (Cer) (PubMed:26116408). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:26116408}.

Entry.Name: YAP5_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Transcription activator involved in the regulation of genes expressed in response to environmental changes and metabolic requirements. According to genome-wide promoter binding and gene expression studies it is a coregulator for the expression of ribosomal genes, while its own expression is induced by the cell cycle specific activator SBF (SWI4-SWI6). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12464632, ECO:0000269|PubMed:14555958, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9372930}.

Entry.Name: INA22_YEAST
Protein.names: Inner membrane assembly complex subunit 22 (INA complex 22 kDa subunit)
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the INA complex (INAC) that promotes the biogenesis of mitochondrial F(1)F(0)-ATP synthase. INAC facilitates the assembly of the peripheral stalk and promotes the assembly of the catalytic F(1)-domain with the membrane-embedded F(0)-domain. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24942160}.

Entry.Name: BZRD_YEAST
Protein.names: Benzil reductase ((S)-benzoin forming) IRC24 (EC 1.1.1.320) (Increased recombination centers protein 24)
Functions: FUNCTION: Reduces benzil stereospecifically to (S)-benzoin. Is probably involved in a pathway contributing to genomic integrity.

Entry.Name: GST1_YEAST
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: YPS6_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Cleaves proteins C-terminally to mono- and paired-basic residues (By similarity). Required for cell wall integrity. {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000269|PubMed:16087741}.

Entry.Name: RN49_YEAST
Protein.names: Large ribosomal subunit protein bL21m (54S ribosomal protein L49, mitochondrial) (YmL49)
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the mitochondrial ribosome (mitoribosome), a dedicated translation machinery responsible for the synthesis of mitochondrial genome-encoded proteins, including at least some of the essential transmembrane subunits of the mitochondrial respiratory chain. The mitoribosomes are attached to the mitochondrial inner membrane and translation products are cotranslationally integrated into the membrane. {ECO:0000305|PubMed:24675956, ECO:0000305|PubMed:25609543}.

Entry.Name: IMA5_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Alpha-glucosidase with specificity for isomaltose, maltose, and palatinose. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20562106}.

Entry.Name: HXT9_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Probable glucose transporter.

Entry.Name: HXT8_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Probable glucose transporter.

Entry.Name: VTH2_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Functions as a sorting receptor in the Golgi compartment required for the intracellular sorting and delivery of soluble vacuolar proteins, like carboxypeptidase Y (CPY) and proteinase A. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:8636229, ECO:0000269|PubMed:8662642}.

Entry.Name: OPT1_YEAST
Gene.Names: OPT1 GSH11 HGT1 YJL212C HRD799 J0236
Functions: FUNCTION: High affinity transporter for glutathione. Also transports tetra- and pentapeptides like the opioids leucine enkephalin (Tyr-Gly-Gly-Phe-Leu) and methionine enkephalin (Tyr-Gly-Gly_Phe-Met) across the cell membrane. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10652283, ECO:0000269|PubMed:10788431}.

Entry.Name: PAC11_YEAST
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: MSH4_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in meiotic recombination. Facilitate crossovers between homologs during meiosis.

Entry.Name: LYS14_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Activates the transcription of lysine biosynthesis genes. This activation is dependent on the inducer alpha-aminoadipate semialdehyde and repressed by lysine.

Entry.Name: PMP2_YEAST
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: HUL4_YEAST
Protein.names: Probable E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase HUL4 (EC 2.3.2.26) (HECT ubiquitin ligase 4) (HECT-type E3 ubiquitin transferase HUL4)
Functions: FUNCTION: Probable E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase, component of the TRAMP (TRF4) complex which has a poly(A) RNA polymerase activity and is involved in a post-transcriptional quality control mechanism limiting inappropriate expression of genetic information. Polyadenylation is required for the degradative activity of the exosome on several of its nuclear RNA substrates. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15828860}.

Entry.Name: CDC1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Probable metallophosphoesterase which may participate in recombinational repair of double -strand breaks.

Entry.Name: RS29A_YEAST
Protein.names: Small ribosomal subunit protein uS14A (40S ribosomal protein S29-A) (S36) (YS29)
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the ribosome, a large ribonucleoprotein complex responsible for the synthesis of proteins in the cell. The small ribosomal subunit (SSU) binds messenger RNAs (mRNAs) and translates the encoded message by selecting cognate aminoacyl-transfer RNA (tRNA) molecules. The large subunit (LSU) contains the ribosomal catalytic site termed the peptidyl transferase center (PTC), which catalyzes the formation of peptide bonds, thereby polymerizing the amino acids delivered by tRNAs into a polypeptide chain. The nascent polypeptides leave the ribosome through a tunnel in the LSU and interact with protein factors that function in enzymatic processing, targeting, and the membrane insertion of nascent chains at the exit of the ribosomal tunnel. {ECO:0000305|PubMed:22096102}.

Entry.Name: RS29B_YEAST
Protein.names: Small ribosomal subunit protein uS14B (40S ribosomal protein S29-B) (S36) (YS29)
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the ribosome, a large ribonucleoprotein complex responsible for the synthesis of proteins in the cell. The small ribosomal subunit (SSU) binds messenger RNAs (mRNAs) and translates the encoded message by selecting cognate aminoacyl-transfer RNA (tRNA) molecules. The large subunit (LSU) contains the ribosomal catalytic site termed the peptidyl transferase center (PTC), which catalyzes the formation of peptide bonds, thereby polymerizing the amino acids delivered by tRNAs into a polypeptide chain. The nascent polypeptides leave the ribosome through a tunnel in the LSU and interact with protein factors that function in enzymatic processing, targeting, and the membrane insertion of nascent chains at the exit of the ribosomal tunnel. {ECO:0000305|PubMed:22096102}.

Entry.Name: SYS1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Necessary for the targeting of ARL3 to the Golgi. Involved in protein trafficking. May serve as a receptor for acetylated ARL3.

Entry.Name: BUD8_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: May be involved in positioning the distal bud pole signal. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11514631}.

Entry.Name: CDC91_YEAST
Protein.names: GPI transamidase component GAB1 (Cell division control protein 91)
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the GPI transamidase complex. May be involved in the recognition of either the GPI attachment signal or the lipid portion of GPI. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12802054}.

Entry.Name: IAH1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Plays a crucial role in the hydrolysis of isoamyl acetate in sake mash (Ref.2). Hydrolyzes short chain esters from acetate (C2) to hexanoate (C6), showing more specificity for shorter chain exters. No activity for decanoate (C10) esters (PubMed:21069734). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21069734, ECO:0000269|Ref.2}.

Entry.Name: VMA21_YEAST
Protein.names: Vacuolar ATPase assembly integral membrane protein VMA21
Functions: FUNCTION: Functions with VOA1 in assembly of the integral membrane sector (also called V0 sector) of the V-ATPase in the endoplasmic reticulum. Escorts the assembled V0 sector in COPII vesicles. Also required for normal packaging of the SNARE BOS1 and possibly the ER to Golgi transport receptor ERV29. {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03058, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15356264, ECO:0000269|PubMed:16926153, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17077122, ECO:0000269|PubMed:18799613, ECO:0000269|PubMed:7841520, ECO:0000269|PubMed:8416931}.

Entry.Name: TRM6_YEAST
Protein.names: tRNA (adenine(58)-N(1))-methyltransferase non-catalytic subunit TRM6 (General control non-derepressible protein 10) (Protein GCD10) (tRNA(m1A58)-methyltransferase subunit TRM6) (tRNA(m1A58)MTase subunit TRM6)
Functions: FUNCTION: Substrate-binding subunit of tRNA (adenine-N(1)-)-methyltransferase, which catalyzes the formation of N(1)-methyladenine at position 58 (m1A58) in initiator methionyl-tRNA (PubMed:10779558, PubMed:9851972). Also required for repression of GCN4 mRNA translation by the upstream open reading frames (uORFs) under conditions of amino acid sufficiency (PubMed:7542616). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10779558, ECO:0000269|PubMed:7542616, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9851972}.

Entry.Name: BAP3_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in transport of isoleucine, leucine, valine, cysteine, methionine, phenylalanine, tyrosine and tryptophan. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10467005, ECO:0000269|PubMed:10654085}.

Entry.Name: GLC8_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Modulator of GLC7 type-1 protein phosphatase.

Entry.Name: DIM1_YEAST
Protein.names: Dimethyladenosine transferase (EC 2.1.1.183) (18S rRNA (adenine(1779)-N(6)/adenine(1780)-N(6))-dimethyltransferase) (18S rRNA dimethylase) (S-adenosylmethionine-6-N', N'-adenosyl(rRNA) dimethyltransferase)
Functions: FUNCTION: Specifically dimethylates two adjacent adenosines in the loop of a conserved hairpin near the 3'-end of 18S rRNA in the 40S particle. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:8064863}.

Entry.Name: MAF1_YEAST
Protein.names: Repressor of RNA polymerase III transcription MAF1
Functions: FUNCTION: Mediator of diverse signals that repress RNA polymerase III transcription. Inhibits the de novo assembly of TFIIIB onto DNA. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12504022}.

Entry.Name: ERFD_YEAST
Protein.names: Ras modification protein ERF4 (Hyperactive Ras suppressor protein 5)
Functions: FUNCTION: The ERF2-SHR5 complex is a palmitoyltransferase specific for Ras proteins (PubMed:12193598, PubMed:12379641, PubMed:7532279). Palmitoylates RAS2, which is required for its proper plasma membrane localization (PubMed:12193598, PubMed:12379641, PubMed:7532279). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12193598, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12379641, ECO:0000269|PubMed:7532279}.

Entry.Name: SSU1_YEAST
Protein.names: Sulfite efflux pump SSU1 (Sulfite sensitivity protein SSU1)
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in efflux of free sulfite. Mutations in the SSU1 gene cause sensitivity to sulfite. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10870099, ECO:0000269|PubMed:8082198}.

Entry.Name: MPG1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in cell wall synthesis where it is required for glycosylation. Involved in cell cycle progression through cell-size checkpoint. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11055399, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9195935}.

Entry.Name: XKS1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Xylulose kinase necessary for growth in culture media with D-xylulose as the solecarbon source. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:9595677}.

Entry.Name: HXT14_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Probable glucose transporter.

Entry.Name: PFS2_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Integral and essential component of the cleavage and polyadenylation factor (CPF) complex, which plays a key role in polyadenylation-dependent pre-mRNA 3'-end formation and cooperates with cleavage factors including the CFIA complex and NAB4/CFIB. May bridge the CPF and CFIA complexes. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10619842}.

Entry.Name: SKP2_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Substrate recognition component of a SCF (SKP1-CUL1-F-box protein) E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase complex which mediates the ubiquitination and subsequent proteasomal degradation of target proteins. Probably recognizes and binds to phosphorylated target proteins (By similarity). Regulates protein levels of sulfur metabolism enzymes. The SCF(SKP2) complex may regulate some transcription factors or regulators of cysteine and methionine biosynthesis. {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000269|PubMed:20936605}.

Entry.Name: KRI1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Required for 40S ribosome biogenesis. Involved in nucleolar processing of pre-18S ribosomal RNA. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11027267}.

Entry.Name: RT18_YEAST
Protein.names: Small ribosomal subunit protein uS11m (37S ribosomal protein S18, mitochondrial) (YmS18)
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the mitochondrial ribosome (mitoribosome), a dedicated translation machinery responsible for the synthesis of mitochondrial genome-encoded proteins, including at least some of the essential transmembrane subunits of the mitochondrial respiratory chain. The mitoribosomes are attached to the mitochondrial inner membrane and translation products are cotranslationally integrated into the membrane. {ECO:0000305|PubMed:25609543, ECO:0000305|PubMed:28154081}.

Entry.Name: SLS1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in aerobic respiration where it is required for assembly of respiratory chain enzyme complexes III and IV. Also has a role in mitochondrial gene expression. May be part of a mitochondrial membrane-associated RNA-shuttling system, delivering NAM1-associated transcripts to the translation machinery. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11805046, ECO:0000269|PubMed:8917313}.

Entry.Name: PMT6_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Protein O-mannosyltransferase involved in O-glycosylation which is essential for cell wall rigidity. Transfers mannose from Dol-P-mannose to Ser or Thr residues on proteins. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P33775, ECO:0000303|PubMed:18182384, ECO:0000303|PubMed:9184828}.

Entry.Name: YCH1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Protein phosphatase. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19382206}.

Entry.Name: TDA10_YEAST
Protein.names: Probable ATP-dependent kinase TDA10 (EC 2.7.-.-) (Topoisomerase I damage affected protein 10)
Functions: FUNCTION: ATP-dependent kinase whose specificity is not yet known.

Entry.Name: GZF3_YEAST
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: GSM1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Transcription factor which regulates nonfermentable carbon utilization (By similarity). Binds specifically to 5'-CGGN(8)CGG-3' and 5'-CGGN(9)CGG-3' sequences in the promoter region. {ECO:0000250}.

Entry.Name: NSE4_YEAST
Protein.names: Non-structural maintenance of chromosome element 4 (Non-SMC element 4) (Protein QRI2)
Functions: FUNCTION: Acts in a DNA repair pathway for removal of UV-induced DNA damage that is distinct from classical nucleotide excision repair and in repair of ionizing radiation damage. Functions in homologous recombination repair of DNA double strand breaks and in recovery of stalled replication forks. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15752197}.

Entry.Name: SNO3_YEAST
Protein.names: Probable pyridoxal 5'-phosphate synthase subunit SNO3 (EC 4.3.3.6) (PDX2 homolog 3) (Pdx2.3) (Pyridoxal 5'-phosphate synthase glutaminase subunit) (EC 3.5.1.2)
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: SNZ3_YEAST
Protein.names: Probable pyridoxal 5'-phosphate synthase subunit SNZ3 (PLP synthase subunit SNZ3) (EC 4.3.3.6) (PDX1 homolog 3) (Pdx1.3)
Functions: FUNCTION: Catalyzes the formation of pyridoxal 5'-phosphate from ribose 5-phosphate (RBP), glyceraldehyde 3-phosphate (G3P) and ammonia. The ammonia is provided by a SNO isoform. Can also use ribulose 5-phosphate and dihydroxyacetone phosphate as substrates, resulting from enzyme-catalyzed isomerization of RBP and G3P, respectively. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q03148}.

Entry.Name: AQY3_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Channel protein that mediates glycerol entry under ethanol stimulation (PubMed:12832087). Does not seem to mediate glycerol uptake under standard conditions (PubMed:12832087). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12832087}.

Entry.Name: DAK2_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Catalyzes both the phosphorylation of dihydroxyacetone and of glyceraldehyde. {ECO:0000250}.

Entry.Name: ZNF1_YEAST
Protein.names: Respiratory transcription factor ZNF1 (Zinc finger protein 1)
Functions: FUNCTION: Transcription factor that regulates respiratory growth and plays a critical role in stress adaptation during non-fermentative growth (PubMed:11353088, PubMed:20975739, PubMed:25673751). Binds to promoters of genes involved in non-fermentative metabolism, including processes such as gluconeogenesis (PCK1, FBP1 and MDH2), glyoxylate shunt (MLS1 and ICL1) and the tricarboxylic acid cycle (ACO1) (PubMed:25673751). Plays a role in maintaining mitochondrial morphology and function (PubMed:25673751). Also plays a role in tolerance to pH and osmotic stress, especially during the oxidative metabolism (PubMed:25673751). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11353088, ECO:0000269|PubMed:20975739, ECO:0000269|PubMed:25673751}.

Entry.Name: ALR2_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Plasma membrane magnesium transporter. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:9430719}.

Entry.Name: SWP82_YEAST
Protein.names: SWI/SNF global transcription activator complex subunit SWP82
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in transcriptional activation. Component of the SWI/SNF complex, an ATP-dependent chromatin remodeling complex, which is required for the positive and negative regulation of gene expression of a large number of genes. It changes chromatin structure by altering DNA-histone contacts within a nucleosome, leading eventually to a change in nucleosome position, thus facilitating or repressing binding of gene-specific transcription factors.

Entry.Name: RGD2_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Acts in signal transduction. Activates CDC42 and RHO5. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11591390}.

Entry.Name: LAM5_YEAST
Protein.names: Membrane-anchored lipid-binding protein LAM5 (Lipid transfer at contact site protein 2) (Lipid transfer protein anchored at membrane contact sites 1)
Functions: FUNCTION: May be involved in sterol transfer between intracellular membranes. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:26001273}.

Entry.Name: CAK1_YEAST
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: CAF16_YEAST
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: GAT1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Positive regulator of multiple nitrogen catabolic genes.

Entry.Name: GNA1_YEAST
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: IES1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Probably involved in transcription regulation via its interaction with the INO80 complex, a chromatin-remodeling complex.

Entry.Name: HXT10_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Probable glucose transporter.

Entry.Name: WWM1_YEAST
Protein.names: WW domain-containing protein WWM1 (WW domain-containing protein interacting with metacaspase)
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in apoptosis. May play a role in nuclear function controlling cellular proliferation coupled to mitochondrial biogenesis. Causes impaired growth when overexpressed. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11274415, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12062425}.

Entry.Name: SAD1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Promotes the assembly of newly synthesized U4 snRNA into the U4/U6 snRNP particle. Required for splicing of pre-mRNA. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10022888}.

Entry.Name: YFH7_YEAST
Protein.names: ATP-dependent kinase YFH7 (EC 2.7.1.-) (Altered inheritance of mitochondria protein 12)
Functions: FUNCTION: ATP-dependent kinase that could be involved in endoplasmic reticulum membrane assembly. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12868057}.

Entry.Name: IOC3_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Functions as component of the ISW1A complex, which acts in remodeling the chromatin by catalyzing an ATP-dependent alteration in the structure of nucleosomal DNA. The ISW1A complex represses gene expression at initiation through specific positioning of a promoter proximal dinucleosome. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12482963, ECO:0000269|PubMed:14622597}.

Entry.Name: ROG3_YEAST
Protein.names: Protein ROG3 (Revertant of glycogen synthase kinase mutation protein 3)
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in resistance to GST substrate o-dinitrobenzene (o-DNB). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12163175}.

Entry.Name: PTR3_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the SPS-sensor system, which regulates the expression of several amino acid-metabolizing enzymes and amino acid- and peptide-permeases in response to extracellular amino acid levels by controlling the activity of two transcription factors, STP1 and STP2. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10409731, ECO:0000269|PubMed:11154269, ECO:0000269|PubMed:11489133, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12502738, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17984223, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9701822}.

Entry.Name: IRC5_YEAST
Protein.names: Uncharacterized ATP-dependent helicase IRC5 (EC 3.6.4.-) (Increased recombination centers protein 5)
Functions: FUNCTION: Is probably involved in a pathway contributing to genomic integrity.

Entry.Name: SA155_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Positive regulator of protein phosphatase SIT4. Involved in directing expression of TOR-repressed genes and in dephosphorylation of NPR1 in response to nutrient starvation. Negatively modulates K(+) efflux of the cell by the Na(+)-K(+)/H(+) antiporter NHA1. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15367655, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15947196}.

Entry.Name: KEG1_YEAST
Protein.names: Beta-1,6-glucan synthesis-associated protein KEG1 (KRE6-binding ER protein responsible for glucan synthesis protein 1)
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in the biosynthesis of (1->6)-beta-D-glucan polymers of the cell wall. Required for viability. Involved in maintaining chromosome stability. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17893149, ECO:0000269|PubMed:18439903}.

Entry.Name: NADC_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in the catabolism of quinolinic acid (QA). {ECO:0000250}.

Entry.Name: COPD_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: The coatomer is a cytosolic protein complex that binds to dilysine motifs and reversibly associates with Golgi non-clathrin-coated vesicles, which further mediate biosynthetic protein transport from the ER, via the Golgi up to the trans Golgi network. Coatomer complex is required for budding from Golgi membranes, and is essential for the retrograde Golgi-to-ER transport of dilysine-tagged proteins (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.

Entry.Name: METC_YEAST
Protein.names: Putative cystathionine beta-lyase (CBL) (EC 4.4.1.13) (Beta-cystathionase) (Cysteine lyase) (Cysteine-S-conjugate beta-lyase) (Increased recombination centers protein 7)
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: CHA4_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Activates the CHA1 gene for L-serine dehydratase. Binds to the DNA sequence 5'-GVGGARAYRTRATTCCRC-3'. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:8889513}.

Entry.Name: TOS3_YEAST
Protein.names: Serine/threonine-protein kinase TOS3 (EC 2.7.11.1) (Target of SBF protein 3)
Functions: FUNCTION: One of the three SNF1 protein kinases (with SAK1 and ELM1) which are required for growth on nonfermentable carbon sources and nonpreferred sugars and for response to environmental stress. Activates SNF1 by phosphorylation of its activation-loop 'Thr-210'. Required for the regulation by SNF1 of the transcription of a large set of genes, the modification the activity of metabolic enzymes, and the control of various nutrient-responsive cellular developmental processes. Phosphorylates also GAL83, MIG1 and SIP2. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11062466, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12906789, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15340085, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15824893, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15879520, ECO:0000269|PubMed:16054096, ECO:0000269|PubMed:16201971, ECO:0000269|PubMed:16607009, ECO:0000269|PubMed:16835226, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17438333}.

Entry.Name: MHP1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Essential for the formation and/or stabilization of microtubules. Binds to microtubules in vitro.

Entry.Name: TBCC_YEAST
Protein.names: Tubulin-specific chaperone C (Chromosome instability protein 2) (Tubulin-folding cofactor C)
Functions: FUNCTION: Tubulin-folding protein; involved in the early step of the tubulin folding pathway.

Entry.Name: FAR3_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Participates in the control of the reentry into the cell cycle following pheromone treatment. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12588993}.

Entry.Name: YAR1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Required for normal rate of cell proliferation.

Entry.Name: RS10B_YEAST
Protein.names: Small ribosomal subunit protein eS10B (40S ribosomal protein S10-B)
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the ribosome, a large ribonucleoprotein complex responsible for the synthesis of proteins in the cell. The small ribosomal subunit (SSU) binds messenger RNAs (mRNAs) and translates the encoded message by selecting cognate aminoacyl-transfer RNA (tRNA) molecules. The large subunit (LSU) contains the ribosomal catalytic site termed the peptidyl transferase center (PTC), which catalyzes the formation of peptide bonds, thereby polymerizing the amino acids delivered by tRNAs into a polypeptide chain. The nascent polypeptides leave the ribosome through a tunnel in the LSU and interact with protein factors that function in enzymatic processing, targeting, and the membrane insertion of nascent chains at the exit of the ribosomal tunnel (PubMed:22096102). eS10 plays a role as a positive regulator of the GCN2 kinase activity by stimulating GCN1-mediated GCN2 activation (PubMed:25437641). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25437641, ECO:0000305|PubMed:22096102}.

Entry.Name: CWC26_YEAST
Protein.names: Pre-mRNA-splicing factor CWC26 (Bud site selection protein 13) (Complexed with CEF1 protein 26) (Synthetic lethal with CLF1 protein 7)
Functions: FUNCTION: Required for efficient splicing and pre-mRNA nuclear retention. May also be involved in positioning the proximal bud pole signal. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11452010, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12871902, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15565172, ECO:0000269|PubMed:8657162}.

Entry.Name: SNG1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: May function as a N-methyl-N'nitro-N-nitrosoguanidine (MNNG) export permease.

Entry.Name: SIP4_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Interacts with the SNF1 protein kinase.

Entry.Name: PHO86_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in the uptake of inorganic phosphate.

Entry.Name: GPI2_YEAST
Protein.names: Phosphatidylinositol N-acetylglucosaminyltransferase GPI2 subunit (GPI-GlcNAc transferase complex subunit GPI2) (GPI-GnT subunit GPI2) (EC 2.4.1.198)
Functions: FUNCTION: Part of the complex catalyzing the transfer of N-acetylglucosamine from UDP-N-acetylglucosamine to phosphatidylinositol, the first step of GPI biosynthesis. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:7768896}.

Entry.Name: SPC1_YEAST
Protein.names: Signal peptidase complex subunit 1 (Microsomal signal peptidase subunit 1)
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the signal peptidase complex (SPC) which catalyzes the cleavage of N-terminal signal sequences from nascent proteins as they are translocated into the lumen of the endoplasmic reticulum (PubMed:8663399). Dispensable for SPC enzymatic activity (PubMed:8663399). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:8663399}.

Entry.Name: RPE_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Catalyzes the reversible epimerization of D-ribulose 5-phosphate to D-xylulose 5-phosphate (By similarity). Involved in the protective response to oxidative stress. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q96AT9, ECO:0000269|PubMed:8879247}.

Entry.Name: NMD5_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Active in protein import into the nucleus. Its major import substrate is transcription elongation factor TFIIS. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:9852143}.

Entry.Name: RSF2_YEAST
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: MNN5_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Responsible for addition of first and second mannose residues to the outer chain of core N-linked polysaccharides and to O-linked mannotriose. Implicated in late Golgi modifications. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:6802821, ECO:0000269|PubMed:6995454, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9756928}.

Entry.Name: PFD1_YEAST
Protein.names: Prefoldin subunit 1 (Genes involved in microtubule biogenesis protein 6) (Gim complex subunit 6) (GimC subunit 6)
Functions: FUNCTION: Binds specifically to cytosolic chaperonin (c-CPN) and transfers target proteins to it. Binds to nascent polypeptide chain and promotes folding in an environment in which there are many competing pathways for nonnative proteins.

Entry.Name: ALB1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: With ARX1, involved in proper assembly of pre-ribosomal particles during the biogenesis of the 60S ribosomal subunit. Accompanies the pre-60S particles to the cytoplasm. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16544271, ECO:0000269|PubMed:16651379, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17242366, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17652132}.

Entry.Name: TAX4_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: With IRS4, acts as a positive regulator of INP51 activity and phosphatidylinositol 4,5-bisphosphate turnover. Negatively regulates signaling through the cell integrity pathway, including the MAP kinase SLT2. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15265867}.

Entry.Name: IML2_YEAST
Protein.names: Inclusion body clearance protein IML2 (Increased minichromosome loss protein 2)
Functions: FUNCTION: Inclusion body (IB) resident protein that interacts strongly with lipid droplet (LD) proteins. Involved in LD-mediated IB clearing after protein folding stress, probably by enabling access to the IBs of an LD-stored soluble sterol derivative that acts as chaperone in inclusion clearing. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:26004510}.

Entry.Name: BTN1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Plays a role in vacuolar arginine transport. Involved in pH homeostasis. May be involved in ion homeostasis together with IST2. Not necessary for mitochondrial function or ATP synthase degradation. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10319861, ECO:0000269|PubMed:11053386, ECO:0000269|PubMed:14660799, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15701790, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9219333}.

Entry.Name: IKS1_YEAST
Protein.names: Probable serine/threonine-protein kinase IKS1 (EC 2.7.11.1) (IRA1 kinase suppressor 1)
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: LPLA_YEAST
Protein.names: Putative lipoate-protein ligase A (EC 6.3.1.20) (Altered inheritance rate of mitochondria protein 22)
Functions: FUNCTION: Catalyzes both the ATP-dependent activation of exogenously supplied lipoate to lipoyl-AMP and the transfer of the activated lipoyl onto the lipoyl domains of lipoate-dependent enzymes. {ECO:0000250}.

Entry.Name: SDHX_YEAST
Protein.names: Succinate dehydrogenase [ubiquinone] flavoprotein subunit 2, mitochondrial (EC 1.3.5.1) (Flavoprotein subunit of complex II) (FP) (SDH1b)
Functions: FUNCTION: Probable minor catalytic subunit of succinate dehydrogenase (SDH) that is involved in complex II of the mitochondrial electron transport chain and is responsible for transferring electrons from succinate to ubiquinone (coenzyme Q). Probably forms a catalytic dimer with SDH2. Electrons flow from succinate to the FAD bound to the catalytic subunit, and sequentially through the iron-sulfur clusters bound to SDH2 and enter the membrane dimer formed by SDH3 and SDH4. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:9730279}.

Entry.Name: LOH1_YEAST
Protein.names: Outer spore wall protein 4 (Loss of heterozygosity protein 1)
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in spore wall assembly (PubMed:23966878). May be involved in maintaining genome integrity (PubMed:18562670). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:18562670, ECO:0000269|PubMed:23966878}.

Entry.Name: IRC18_YEAST
Protein.names: Outer spore wall protein 6 (Increased recombination centers protein 18)
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in spore wall assembly. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:23966878}.

Entry.Name: AP3S_YEAST
Protein.names: AP-3 complex subunit sigma (AP-3 complex sigma3A subunit) (Adaptor-related protein complex 3 subunit sigma) (Clathrin-associated/assembly/adaptor protein, small 3) (Sigma-adaptin 3A) (Sigma3-adaptin)
Functions: FUNCTION: Part of the AP-3 complex, an adaptor-related complex which is not clathrin-associated. The complex is associated with the Golgi region as well as more peripheral structures. It facilitates the budding of vesicles from the Golgi membrane and may be directly involved in trafficking to the vacuole. Required for the transport via the ALP pathway, which directs the transport of the cargo proteins PHO8 and VAM3 to the vacuole. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10559961, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9250663, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9335339}.

Entry.Name: TCPQ_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Molecular chaperone; assists the folding of proteins upon ATP hydrolysis. Known to play a role, in vitro, in the folding of actin and tubulin. In yeast may play a role in mitotic spindle formation (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.

Entry.Name: GPI14_YEAST
Protein.names: GPI mannosyltransferase 1 (EC 2.4.1.-) (GPI mannosyltransferase I) (GPI-MT-I) (Glycosylphosphatidylinositol-anchor biosynthesis protein 14)
Functions: FUNCTION: Mannosyltransferase involved in glycosylphosphatidylinositol-anchor biosynthesis. Transfers the first alpha-1,4-mannose to GlcN-acyl-PI during GPI precursor assembly. Required for cell wall integrity. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16134120}.

Entry.Name: MTNB_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Catalyzes the dehydration of methylthioribulose-1-phosphate (MTRu-1-P) into 2,3-diketo-5-methylthiopentyl-1-phosphate (DK-MTP-1-P). {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03116, ECO:0000269|PubMed:18625006}.

Entry.Name: URB2_YEAST
Protein.names: Nucleolar pre-ribosomal-associated protein 2 (Unhealthy ribosome biogenesis protein 2)
Functions: FUNCTION: Required for 27S pre-rRNA processing. Has an early role during 60S ribosomal subunit assembly. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15242642, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17145778}.

Entry.Name: ARP3_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Functions as ATP-binding component of the Arp2/3 complex which is involved in regulation of actin polymerization and together with an activating nucleation-promoting factor (NPF) mediates the formation of branched actin networks. Seems to contact the pointed end of the daughter actin filament (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.

Entry.Name: YAE1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: The complex LTO1:YAE1 functions as a target specific adapter that recruits apo-RLI1 to the cytosolic iron-sulfur protein assembly (CIA) complex machinery. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:26182403}.

Entry.Name: MOG1_YEAST
Protein.names: Nuclear import protein MOG1 (Multicopy suppressor of GSP1)
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in the Ran-GTPase system for nuclear protein import and poly(A)+ mRNA export. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11509570, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9860978}.

Entry.Name: I23O_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Catalyzes the first step in tryptophan catabolism in order to supply de novo nicotinamide adenine dinucleotide (NAD(+)) via the kynurenine pathway. Plays a role in the cellular response to telomere uncapping. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12062417, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12972620, ECO:0000269|PubMed:18828915, ECO:0000269|PubMed:21170645}.

Entry.Name: CSN12_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the COP9 signalosome (CSN) complex that acts as an regulator of the ubiquitin (Ubl) conjugation pathway by mediating the deneddylation of the cullin subunit of SCF-type E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase complexes. The CSN complex is involved in the regulation of the mating pheromone response. CSN12 forms a complex with THP3 that is recruited to transcribed genes and required for transcription elongation. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12446563, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19061648, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19289793, ECO:0000269|PubMed:21149575}.

Entry.Name: EMC2_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Part of the endoplasmic reticulum membrane protein complex (EMC) that enables the energy-independent insertion into endoplasmic reticulum membranes of newly synthesized membrane proteins (PubMed:29809151). Preferentially accommodates proteins with transmembrane domains that are weakly hydrophobic or contain destabilizing features such as charged and aromatic residues (PubMed:29809151). Involved in the cotranslational insertion of multi-pass membrane proteins in which stop-transfer membrane-anchor sequences become ER membrane spanning helices (PubMed:29809151). It is also required for the post-translational insertion of tail-anchored/TA proteins in endoplasmic reticulum membranes. By mediating the proper cotranslational insertion of N-terminal transmembrane domains in an N-exo topology, with translocated N-terminus in the lumen of the ER, controls the topology of multi-pass membrane proteins (By similarity). {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q15006, ECO:0000269|PubMed:29809151}.

Entry.Name: JSN1_YEAST
Protein.names: Protein JSN1 (Pumilio homology domain family member 1)
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: YJ66_YEAST
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: DPH4_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Required for the first step of diphthamide biosynthesis, the transfer of 3-amino-3-carboxypropyl from S-adenosyl-L-methionine to a histidine residue. Diphthamide is a post-translational modification of histidine which occurs in elongation factor 2. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15485916}.

Entry.Name: YMR1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Lipid phosphatase which dephosphorylates phosphatidylinositol 3-monophosphate (PI3P). Involved in the control of PI3P-dependent signaling and in the maintenance of endosomal system integrity. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10900271, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15169871}.

Entry.Name: NNF1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Acts as essential component of the kinetochore MIND complex, which is required for the spindle checkpoint and kinetochore integrity. MIND plays a role in establishing a bipolar spindle-kinetochore interaction by joining kinetochore subunits contacting DNA to those contacting microtubules. NNF1 is required for a number of nuclear functions. Cells depleted of NNF11 or containing a temperature-sensitive NNF1 mutation have elongated microtubules and become bi- and multinucleate. They also have a fragmented nucleolus and accumulate poly(A)+ RNA inside the nucleus. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12455957, ECO:0000269|PubMed:14633972}.

Entry.Name: RT07_YEAST
Protein.names: Small ribosomal subunit protein uS7m (37S ribosomal protein S7, mitochondrial)
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the mitochondrial ribosome (mitoribosome), a dedicated translation machinery responsible for the synthesis of mitochondrial genome-encoded proteins, including at least some of the essential transmembrane subunits of the mitochondrial respiratory chain. The mitoribosomes are attached to the mitochondrial inner membrane and translation products are cotranslationally integrated into the membrane. {ECO:0000305|PubMed:25609543, ECO:0000305|PubMed:28154081}.

Entry.Name: VPS70_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in vacuolar protein sorting. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12134085}.

Entry.Name: CENPK_YEAST
Protein.names: Inner kinetochore subunit MCM22 (CENP-K homolog) (Constitutive centromere-associated network protein MCM22) (Minichromosome maintenance protein 22)
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: DAN4_YEAST
Protein.names: Cell wall protein DAN4 (Delayed anaerobic protein 4)
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: PGLR_YEAST
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: HXT16_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Probable glucose transporter.

Entry.Name: ALDH2_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Cytoplasmic aldehyde dehydrogenase involved in ethanol oxidation. Required for pantothenic acid production through the conversion of 3-aminopropanal to beta-alanine, an intermediate in pantothenic acid (vitamin B5) and coenzyme A (CoA) biosynthesis. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10407263, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12586697}.

Entry.Name: TEA1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: TY1 element enhancer binding protein. Binds to the DNA sequence 5'-TCGGTGGTATTATTCCGA-3'.

Entry.Name: GCST_YEAST
Protein.names: Aminomethyltransferase, mitochondrial (EC 2.1.2.10) (Glycine cleavage system T protein) (GCVT) (Glycine decarboxylase complex subunit T)
Functions: FUNCTION: The glycine cleavage system (glycine decarboxylase complex) catalyzes the degradation of glycine.

Entry.Name: SNAPN_YEAST
Protein.names: Biogenesis of lysosome-related organelles complex 1 subunit SNN1 (BLOC-1 subunit SNN1) (SNAPIN-like protein 1)
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the biogenesis of lysosome-related organelles complex-1 (BLOC-1), a complex involved in endosomal cargo sorting. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21159114}.

Entry.Name: NOL10_YEAST
Protein.names: Ribosome biogenesis protein ENP2 (Essential nuclear protein 2)
Functions: FUNCTION: May be involved in rRNA-processing and ribosome biosynthesis. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16544271}.

Entry.Name: GTO1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Active as '1-Cys' thiol transferase against beta-hydroxyethyl disulfide (HED), as dehydroascorbate reductase and as dimethylarsinic acid reductase, while not active against the standard GST substrate 1-chloro-2,4-dinitrobenzene (CDNB). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16709151}.

Entry.Name: ASK10_YEAST
Protein.names: Activator of SKN7 protein 10 (Regulator of the glycerol channel 2)
Functions: FUNCTION: Positive regulator of FPS1 glycerol channel required for the glycerol efflux. As a component of the RNA polymerase II holoenzyme, is required for SSN8 destruction in response to oxidative stress but not heat shock. Required for cell survival in response to heat shock independent of SSN8. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:14555478, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19956799}.

Entry.Name: GYP7_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: GTPase-activating protein (GAP) that most effectively accelerates the intrinsic GTPase activity of Ypt/Rab-type GTPase YPT7 involved in vacuole docking and fusion (PubMed:10091609, PubMed:11210571). It is also active, but to a lesser extent, on YPT31, YPT32, YPT1, YPT6 and SEC4 (PubMed:10091609, PubMed:11210571). Provides a catalytic arginine (arginine finger) in trans to accelerate the GTP hydrolysis rate of the substrate GTPase (Probable). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10091609, ECO:0000269|PubMed:11210571, ECO:0000305|PubMed:10508155}.

Entry.Name: SYEM_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Catalyzes the attachment of glutamate to tRNA(Glu) in a two-step reaction: glutamate is first activated by ATP to form Glu-AMP and then transferred to the acceptor end of tRNA(Glu). {ECO:0000250}.

Entry.Name: SYYM_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Catalyzes the attachment of tyrosine to tRNA(Tyr) in a two-step reaction: tyrosine is first activated by ATP to form Tyr-AMP and then transferred to the acceptor end of tRNA(Tyr). {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q9Y2Z4}.

Entry.Name: PALH_YEAST
Protein.names: pH-response regulator protein palH/RIM21 (Regulator of IME2 protein 21)
Functions: FUNCTION: Required for the proteolytic cleavage of the transcription factor RIM101 in response to alkaline ambient pH (By similarity). Required for growth at alkaline pH. {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000269|PubMed:10821185}.

Entry.Name: PUS4_YEAST
Protein.names: tRNA pseudouridine synthase 4 (EC 5.4.99.25) (tRNA pseudouridine(55) synthase) (Psi55 synthase) (tRNA pseudouridylate synthase 4) (tRNA-uridine isomerase 4)
Functions: FUNCTION: Responsible for synthesis of pseudouridine from uracil-55 in the psi GC loop of transfer RNAs (PubMed:9358157). Also catalyzes pseudouridylation of mRNAs with the consensus sequence 5'-GGUUCRA-3' (PubMed:25219674). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25219674, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9358157}.

Entry.Name: HOSC_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Catalyzes the aldol-type condensation of 2-oxoglutarate with acetyl-CoA to yield homocitrate. Carries out the first step of the alpha-aminoadipate (AAA) lysine biosynthesis pathway. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:O87198}.

Entry.Name: TBCA_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Tubulin-folding protein; involved in the early step of the tubulin folding pathway.

Entry.Name: RFX1_YEAST
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: ASNS2_YEAST
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: RL38_YEAST
Protein.names: Large ribosomal subunit protein eL38 (60S ribosomal protein L38)
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the ribosome, a large ribonucleoprotein complex responsible for the synthesis of proteins in the cell. The small ribosomal subunit (SSU) binds messenger RNAs (mRNAs) and translates the encoded message by selecting cognate aminoacyl-transfer RNA (tRNA) molecules. The large subunit (LSU) contains the ribosomal catalytic site termed the peptidyl transferase center (PTC), which catalyzes the formation of peptide bonds, thereby polymerizing the amino acids delivered by tRNAs into a polypeptide chain. The nascent polypeptides leave the ribosome through a tunnel in the LSU and interact with protein factors that function in enzymatic processing, targeting, and the membrane insertion of nascent chains at the exit of the ribosomal tunnel. {ECO:0000305|PubMed:22096102}.

Entry.Name: LYS4_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Catalyzes the reversible hydration of cis-homoaconitate to (2R,3S)-homoisocitrate, a step in the alpha-aminoadipate pathway for lysine biosynthesis. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:23106124, ECO:0000269|PubMed:2507177}.

Entry.Name: NIT3_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Possesses omega-amidase activity (PubMed:28373563). The role of omega-amidase is to remove potentially toxic intermediates by converting 2-oxoglutaramate and 2-oxosuccinamate to biologically useful 2-oxoglutarate and oxaloacetate, respectively. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:28373563}.

Entry.Name: SF3B1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Contacts pre-mRNA on both sides of the branch site early in spliceosome assembly. {ECO:0000250}.

Entry.Name: PRP24_YEAST
Protein.names: U4/U6 snRNA-associated-splicing factor PRP24 (U4/U6 snRNP protein)
Functions: FUNCTION: Binds preferentially to the U4/U6 hybrid snRNAs. Can stimulate the annealing of U4 and U6. Could participate in both the formation and disassembly of the U4/U6 hybrid during splicing.

Entry.Name: CCH1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Voltage-gated, high-affinity calcium channel involved in calcium influx in response to some environmental stresses as well as exposure to mating pheromones. Functions together with MID1 to ensure that adequate levels of Ca(2+) are supplied to PMR1 to sustain secretion and growth. Required for growth in low-calcium environments. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10958666, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9343395}.

Entry.Name: TOS2_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Seems to be involved in the anchoring of CDC24 to the membrane of polarized growth sites. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:14872283}.

Entry.Name: AZR1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Transporter protein required for adaptation to high stress imposed by low-chain organic acids, in particular by acetic acid, and for resistance to azoles, especially to ketoconazole and fluconazole. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11113970}.

Entry.Name: PSD10_YEAST
Protein.names: Probable 26S proteasome regulatory subunit p28 (Proteasome non-ATPase subunit 6)
Functions: FUNCTION: Acts as a chaperone during the assembly of the 26S proteasome, specifically of the 19S regulatory complex (RC) and appears to have an overlapping role with RPN14. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19412159, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19446322, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9714768}.

Entry.Name: PSP2_YEAST
Protein.names: Protein PSP2 (Mitochondrial regulator of splicing 15) (Polymerase suppressor protein 2)
Functions: FUNCTION: DNA polymerase alpha mutation suppressor. Suppressor of group II intron splicing defects of a mutation in MRS2. May play a role in mitochondrial mRNA splicing. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:8252639, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9529527}.

Entry.Name: MUP1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: High affinity permease for methionine.

Entry.Name: BIOA_YEAST
Protein.names: Adenosylmethionine-8-amino-7-oxononanoate aminotransferase (EC 2.6.1.62) (7,8-diamino-pelargonic acid aminotransferase) (DAPA AT) (DAPA aminotransferase) (Diaminopelargonic acid synthase)
Functions: FUNCTION: Catalyzes the transfer of the alpha-amino group from S-adenosyl-L-methionine (SAM) to 7-keto-8-aminopelargonic acid (KAPA) to form 7,8-diaminopelargonic acid (DAPA) (PubMed:10333520). It is the only aminotransferase known to utilize SAM as an amino donor (PubMed:10333520). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10333520}.

Entry.Name: SOL1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: May be involved in regulation of tRNA subcellular distribution. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15454531}.

Entry.Name: PSP1_YEAST
Protein.names: Protein PSP1 (Growth inhibitory protein 5) (Polymerase suppressor protein 1)
Functions: FUNCTION: DNA polymerase alpha mutation suppressor.

Entry.Name: AVT4_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in amino acid efflux from the vacuole to the cytoplasm. Capable of transporting large neutral amino acids including tyrosine, glutamine, asparagine, isoleucine and leucine. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11274162}.

Entry.Name: OCA1_YEAST
Protein.names: Putative tyrosine-protein phosphatase OCA1 (EC 3.1.3.48) (Oxidant-induced cell-cycle arrest protein 1)
Functions: FUNCTION: Putative tyrosine-protein phosphatase required for protection against superoxide stress. Involved in cell-cycle delay in response to linoleic acid hydroperoxide (LoaOOH). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11408586, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12912987, ECO:0000269|PubMed:18205808}.

Entry.Name: RL9B_YEAST
Protein.names: Large ribosomal subunit protein uL6B (60S ribosomal protein L9-B) (L8) (RP24) (YL11)
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the ribosome, a large ribonucleoprotein complex responsible for the synthesis of proteins in the cell. The small ribosomal subunit (SSU) binds messenger RNAs (mRNAs) and translates the encoded message by selecting cognate aminoacyl-transfer RNA (tRNA) molecules. The large subunit (LSU) contains the ribosomal catalytic site termed the peptidyl transferase center (PTC), which catalyzes the formation of peptide bonds, thereby polymerizing the amino acids delivered by tRNAs into a polypeptide chain. The nascent polypeptides leave the ribosome through a tunnel in the LSU and interact with protein factors that function in enzymatic processing, targeting, and the membrane insertion of nascent chains at the exit of the ribosomal tunnel. {ECO:0000305|PubMed:22096102}.

Entry.Name: PDR10_YEAST
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: SHE4_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Required for mother cell-specific ho expression. Might be required for the transport of factors (such as ASH1) that promote HO repression from the mother cell into its bud.

Entry.Name: RL4P_YEAST
Protein.names: Large ribosomal subunit protein uL4m (54S ribosomal protein YmL6, mitochondrial)
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the mitochondrial ribosome (mitoribosome), a dedicated translation machinery responsible for the synthesis of mitochondrial genome-encoded proteins, including at least some of the essential transmembrane subunits of the mitochondrial respiratory chain. The mitoribosomes are attached to the mitochondrial inner membrane and translation products are cotranslationally integrated into the membrane. {ECO:0000305|PubMed:24675956, ECO:0000305|PubMed:25609543}.

Entry.Name: UBC11_YEAST
Protein.names: Ubiquitin-conjugating enzyme E2-18 kDa (EC 2.3.2.23) (E2 ubiquitin-conjugating enzyme 11) (Ubiquitin carrier protein) (Ubiquitin-protein ligase)
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: PMT5_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Protein O-mannosyltransferase involved in O-glycosylation which is essential for cell wall rigidity. Forms a heterodimeric complex with PMT3 and more rarely with PMT2 to transfer mannose from Dol-P-mannose to Ser or Thr residues on proteins. {ECO:0000303|PubMed:12551906}.

Entry.Name: CWC23_YEAST
Protein.names: Pre-mRNA-splicing factor CWC23 (Complexed with CEF1 protein 23)
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in pre-mRNA splicing. May be involved in endoplasmic reticulum-associated protein degradation (ERAD) and required for growth at low and high temperatures. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10029993, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12847107, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15170475}.

Entry.Name: ALAT_YEAST
Protein.names: Probable alanine aminotransferase (EC 2.6.1.2) (Glutamate pyruvate transaminase) (GPT) (Glutamic--alanine transaminase) (Glutamic--pyruvic transaminase)
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: ALAM_YEAST
Protein.names: Probable alanine aminotransferase, mitochondrial (EC 2.6.1.2) (Glutamate pyruvate transaminase) (GPT) (Glutamic--alanine transaminase) (Glutamic--pyruvic transaminase)
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: NBP1_YEAST
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: AIF1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Putative FAD-dependent oxidoreductase involved in the resistance to cercosporin and other singlet oxygen-generating photosensitizers. Translocates from mitochondria to the nucleus under apoptotic conditions, where it degrades DNA and induces apoptosis. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11409174, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15381687, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15939758}.

Entry.Name: MNT2_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Mannosyltransferase involved in adding the 4th and 5th mannose residues of O-linked glycans.

Entry.Name: BRR6_YEAST
Protein.names: Nucleus export protein BRR6 (Bad response to refrigeration protein 6)
Functions: FUNCTION: Required for mRNA nuclear export. Involved in the nuclear pore complex (NPC) distribution and nuclear envelope morphology. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11483521, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15882446}.

Entry.Name: TAD1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Deaminates adenosine-37 to inosine in tRNA-Ala.

Entry.Name: MTO1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in the 5-carboxymethylaminomethyl modification (mnm(5)s(2)U34) of the wobble uridine base in mitochondrial tRNAs.

Entry.Name: EMC4_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Part of the endoplasmic reticulum membrane protein complex (EMC) that enables the energy-independent insertion into endoplasmic reticulum membranes of newly synthesized membrane proteins (PubMed:29809151). Preferentially accommodates proteins with transmembrane domains that are weakly hydrophobic or contain destabilizing features such as charged and aromatic residues (PubMed:29809151). Involved in the cotranslational insertion of multi-pass membrane proteins in which stop-transfer membrane-anchor sequences become ER membrane spanning helices (PubMed:29809151). It is also required for the post-translational insertion of tail-anchored/TA proteins in endoplasmic reticulum membranes. By mediating the proper cotranslational insertion of N-terminal transmembrane domains in an N-exo topology, with translocated N-terminus in the lumen of the ER, controls the topology of multi-pass membrane proteins (By similarity). {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q5J8M3, ECO:0000269|PubMed:29809151}.

Entry.Name: SHE10_YEAST
Protein.names: Outer spore wall assembly protein SHE10 (Sensitivity to high expression protein 10)
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in spore wall assembly (PubMed:23966878). May be a component of the mitochondrial RNase MRP (MtMRP), a ribonucleoprotein endoribonuclease involved in the cleaving RNA transcripts to generate primers for DNA replication in mitochondria (PubMed:20086051). Causes growth arrest when highly overexpressed (PubMed:7762298). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20086051, ECO:0000269|PubMed:23966878, ECO:0000269|PubMed:7762298}.

Entry.Name: EDC1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: mRNA-binding protein which stimulates mRNA decapping by DCP1 and DCP2. Involved in the regulation of expression of multiple genes involved in glycolysis and gluconeogenesis. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11139489, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12554866, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12554867}.

Entry.Name: MDS3_YEAST
Protein.names: Negative regulator of sporulation MDS3 (MCK1 dosage suppressor 3)
Functions: FUNCTION: Negatively regulates early sporulation-specific genes. Seems to exert its function by positively regulating the Ras/cAMP pathway. Required for growth under alkaline conditions. Acts synergetically with PMD1. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12524333, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19087957}.

Entry.Name: MND1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Required for proper homologous chromosome pairing and efficient cross-over and intragenic recombination during meiosis. Stimulates DMC1-dependent homologous strand assimilation, which is required for the resolution of meiotic double-strand breaks. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11940665, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12011448, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15120066, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15249670}.

Entry.Name: YRB30_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Important for the export of protein containing nuclear export signal (NES) out of the nucleus. Stimulates the GTPase activity of GSP1. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12578832}.

Entry.Name: YIP5_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Possible role in vesicle-mediated transport. May be involved in proper membrane localization of Rab GTPases. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17178117}.

Entry.Name: ARI1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: NADPH-dependent aldehyde reductase involved in the detoxification of aldehyde inhibitors derived from lignocellulosic biomass conversion. Reduces commonly detected inhibitors in biomass conversion hydrolysates such as furfural, 5-hydroxymethylfurfural (HMF), cinnamic aldehyde, benzaldehyde, phenylacetaldehyde, and anisaldehyde. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:14574691, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19577617, ECO:0000269|PubMed:20525870}.

Entry.Name: FLC3_YEAST
Protein.names: Putative flavin carrier protein 3 (FAD transporter 3) (TRP-like ion channel FLC3)
Functions: FUNCTION: May be responsible for the transport of FAD into the endoplasmic reticulum lumen, where it is required for oxidative protein folding. {ECO:0000250}.

Entry.Name: MRM2_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: S-adenosyl-L-methionine-dependent 2'-O-ribose methyltransferase that catalyzes the formation of 2'-O-methyluridine at position 2791 (Um2791) in the 21S mitochondrial large subunit ribosomal RNA (mtLSU rRNA), a universally conserved modification in the peptidyl transferase domain of the mtLSU rRNA. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11867542}.

Entry.Name: PCL10_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Cyclin partner of the cyclin-dependent kinase (CDK) PHO85. Together with cyclin PCL8, negatively controls glycogen accumulation under favorable growth conditions. The PCL10-PHO85 cyclin-CDK holoenzyme has glycogen synthase kinase activity and phosphorylates and negatively regulates glycogen synthase GSY2. Also has minor GLC8 kinase activity. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10490639, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12407105, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9584169}.

Entry.Name: ITC1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Functions as component of the ISW2 complex, which acts in remodeling the chromatin by catalyzing an ATP-dependent alteration in the structure of nucleosomal DNA. The ISW2 complex is involved in coordinating transcriptional repression and in inheritance of telomeric silencing. It is involved in repression of MAT a-specific genes, INO1, and early meiotic genes during mitotic growth dependent upon transcription factor UME6 and in a parallel pathway to the RPD3-SIN3 histone deacetylase complex. ITC1 is required for nucleosome-stimulated ATPase activity and chromatin-remodeling activity of the complex. Required for the repression of MATa a-specific genes. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11081629, ECO:0000269|PubMed:11238944, ECO:0000269|PubMed:11489850, ECO:0000269|PubMed:11533234, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12624196, ECO:0000269|PubMed:14673157}.

Entry.Name: MTHR2_YEAST
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: NSA1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in the biogenesis of the 60S ribosomal subunit. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16544271}.

Entry.Name: LIF1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Stabilizes DNL4. Involved in non-homologous repair of DNA double-strand breaks. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:9670033}.

Entry.Name: LCL3_YEAST
Protein.names: Probable endonuclease LCL3 (EC 3.1.-.-) (Long chronological lifespan protein 3)
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: KXD1_YEAST
Protein.names: Biogenesis of lysosome-related organelles complex 1 subunit KXD1 (BLOC-1 subunit KXD1) (KxDL homolog)
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the biogenesis of lysosome-related organelles complex-1 (BLOC-1) involved in endosomal cargo sorting. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21159114}.

Entry.Name: PUS2_YEAST
Protein.names: tRNA pseudouridine(27/28) synthase (EC 5.4.99.44) (tRNA pseudouridine synthase 2) (tRNA pseudouridylate synthase 2) (tRNA-uridine isomerase 2)
Functions: FUNCTION: Mitochondrial-specific pseudouridine synthase catalyzing the formation of pseudouridine at positions 27 and 28 in the anticodon stem and loop of mitochondrial transfer RNAs. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17684231}.

Entry.Name: YBP2_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in oxidative stress response and redox homeostasis. Required for hydrogen peroxide-induced activation of YAP1. Acts in a parallele pathway to YBP1. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11570514, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12743123, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15075262, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9990050}.

Entry.Name: PRM8_YEAST
Protein.names: Pheromone-regulated membrane protein 8 (DUP240 protein PRM8) (Protein DUP1)
Functions: FUNCTION: May be involved in endoplasmic reticulum exit trafficking of proteins.

Entry.Name: TYW3_YEAST
