Functions: FUNCTION: M/G1-specific cyclin partner of the cyclin-dependent kinase (CDK) PHO85. May have a role in bud site selection in G1 phase. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:9529390, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9593297}.

Entry.Name: RM23_YEAST
Protein.names: Large ribosomal subunit protein uL13m (54S ribosomal protein L23, mitochondrial) (YmL23)
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the mitochondrial ribosome (mitoribosome), a dedicated translation machinery responsible for the synthesis of mitochondrial genome-encoded proteins, including at least some of the essential transmembrane subunits of the mitochondrial respiratory chain. The mitoribosomes are attached to the mitochondrial inner membrane and translation products are cotranslationally integrated into the membrane. {ECO:0000305|PubMed:24675956, ECO:0000305|PubMed:25609543}.

Entry.Name: NKP1_YEAST
Protein.names: Inner kinetochore subunit NKP1 (Constitutive centromere-associated network protein NKP1) (Non-essential kinetochore protein 1)
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the kinetochore, a multiprotein complex that assembles on centromeric DNA and attaches chromosomes to spindle microtubules, mediating chromosome segregation and sister chromatid segregation during meiosis and mitosis. Component of the inner kinetochore constitutive centromere-associated network (CCAN), which serves as a structural platform for outer kinetochore assembly. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22561346}.

Entry.Name: CMR1_YEAST
Protein.names: DNA damage-binding protein CMR1 (Changed mutation rate protein 1)
Functions: FUNCTION: DNA-binding protein that binds to both single- and double-stranded DNA. Binds preferentially to UV-damaged DNA in vitro (PubMed:22367945). May be involved in DNA-metabolic processes (PubMed:23349438). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22367945, ECO:0000305|PubMed:23349438}.

Entry.Name: TMA17_YEAST
Protein.names: Translation machinery-associated protein 17 (ATPase-dedicated chaperone of 17 kDa) (ADC17)
Functions: FUNCTION: ATPase-dedicated chaperone that assists the formation of the RPT6-RPT3 ATPase pair, an early step in proteasome assembly. Plays a key role in maintaining homeostatic proteasome levels and adjusting proteasome assembly when demands increase, such as during proteasome stresses. Function overlaps with RPN14. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25042801}.

Entry.Name: SRF1_YEAST
Protein.names: Regulator of phospholipase D SRF1 (SPO14 regulatory factor 1)
Functions: FUNCTION: Regulator of phospholipase D (SPO14) which is required for SPO14 catalytic activity in mitotic cells. Essential to buffer the toxic effects of C16:0 platelet activating factor. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21347278}.

Entry.Name: HUT1_YEAST
Protein.names: UDP-galactose transporter homolog 1 (Multicopy suppressor of leflunomide-sensitivity protein 6)
Functions: FUNCTION: May be involved in specific transport of UDP-Gal from the cytosol to the Golgi lumen. Involved in the maintenance of optimal conditions for the folding of secretory pathway proteins in the endoplasmic reticulum. Overexpression confers resistance to the immunosuppressive drug, leflunomide. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11284009, ECO:0000269|PubMed:11284010, ECO:0000269|PubMed:11391470}.

Entry.Name: MHT1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Homocysteine S-methyltransferase involved in the conversion of S-adenosylmethionine (AdoMet) to methionine to control the methionine/AdoMet ratio. Also converts S-methylmethionine (SMM) to methionine. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11013242}.

Entry.Name: FOLD_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Glutamate-adding enzyme which catalyzes the binding of the first glutamyl side chain to dihydropteroate. Leads to the de nove synthesis of tetrahydrofolate. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11731153}.

Entry.Name: DFM1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: May be involved in the degradation process of some misfolded endoplasmic reticulum (ER) luminal proteins. Its precise role is however unclear and its inability to complement der1 mutations, suggests either that it is not involved in degradation process of misfolded proteins, or that it participates in the destruction of specific misfolded ER luminal proteins. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15093775}.

Entry.Name: RTP1_YEAST
Protein.names: RNA polymerase II assembly factor RTP1 (Required for nuclear transport of RNA pol II protein 1) (Transport and Golgi organization protein 6 homolog)
Functions: FUNCTION: Required for the cytoplasmic assembly and the nuclear import of RNA polymerase II. May facilitate the starting interaction between RNA polymerase II subunits RPB2 and RPB3 and the subsequent interaction of the resulting complex with subunit RPB1. May also participate in the transport of RNA polymerase II through the nuclear pore complex. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:23438601}.

Entry.Name: HAA1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Regulates the transcription of a set of genes, many of which encode membrane proteins. Among the genes regulated are YGR138C and YRO2. Does not seem to be dependent on copper. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11504737}.

Entry.Name: COX26_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the cytochrome c oxidase, the last enzyme in the mitochondrial electron transport chain which drives oxidative phosphorylation. The respiratory chain contains 3 multisubunit complexes succinate dehydrogenase (complex II, CII), ubiquinol-cytochrome c oxidoreductase (cytochrome b-c1 complex, complex III, CIII) and cytochrome c oxidase (complex IV, CIV), that cooperate to transfer electrons derived from NADH and succinate to molecular oxygen, creating an electrochemical gradient over the inner membrane that drives transmembrane transport and the ATP synthase. Cytochrome c oxidase is the component of the respiratory chain that catalyzes the reduction of oxygen to water. Electrons originating from reduced cytochrome c in the intermembrane space (IMS) are transferred via the dinuclear copper A center (CU(A)) of COX2 and heme A of COX1 to the active site in COX1, a binuclear center (BNC) formed by heme A3 and copper B (CU(B)). The BNC reduces molecular oxygen to 2 water molecules using 4 electrons from cytochrome c in the IMS and 4 protons from the mitochondrial matrix. {ECO:0000305|PubMed:30598554}.

Entry.Name: EFG1P_YEAST
Protein.names: rRNA-processing protein EFG1 (Exit from G1 protein 1)
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in rRNA processing. Required growth at elevated temperatures, resistance to hydroxyurea and for cell cycle progression. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12837249, ECO:0000269|PubMed:16510898}.

Entry.Name: COX19_YEAST
Protein.names: Cytochrome c oxidase assembly protein COX19
Functions: FUNCTION: Required for the assembly of mitochondrial cytochrome c oxidase. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12171940}.

Entry.Name: SDHF1_YEAST
Protein.names: Succinate dehydrogenase assembly factor 1, mitochondrial (SDH assembly factor 1) (SDHAF1)
Functions: FUNCTION: Plays an essential role in the assembly of succinate dehydrogenase (SDH), an enzyme complex (also referred to as respiratory complex II) that is a component of both the tricarboxylic acid (TCA) cycle and the mitochondrial electron transport chain, and which couples the oxidation of succinate to fumarate with the reduction of ubiquinone (coenzyme Q) to ubiquinol. Promotes maturation of the iron-sulfur protein subunit SDH2 of the SDH catalytic dimer, protecting it from the deleterious effects of oxidants. Acts together with SDHAF3 (SDH7). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19465911}.

Entry.Name: TSC3_YEAST
Protein.names: Serine palmitoyltransferase-regulating protein TSC3 (Temperature-sensitive CSG2-mutant suppressor protein 3)
Functions: FUNCTION: Stimulates the activity of serine palmitoyltransferase (SPT).

Entry.Name: MIM2_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the MIM complex required for outer membrane protein import (PubMed:22467864). Involved in import of the subset of proteins with multiple alpha-helical transmembrane segments, including UGO1, TOM20 and FZO1 (PubMed:22467864). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22467864}.

Entry.Name: COXM2_YEAST
Protein.names: COX assembly mitochondrial protein 2 (Cx9C motif-containing protein 2) (Mitochondrial metallochaperone-like protein CMC2)
Functions: FUNCTION: Required for mitochondrial cytochrome c oxidase (COX) assembly and respiration. May be involved in copper trafficking and distribution to mitochondrial COX and SOD1. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19703468, ECO:0000269|PubMed:20220131}.

Entry.Name: COA3_YEAST
Protein.names: Cytochrome c oxidase assembly factor 3, mitochondrial (Cytochrome c oxidase protein 25) (Required for respiratory growth protein 10)
Functions: FUNCTION: Required for assembly of cytochrome c oxidase (complex IV). With COX14, regulates negatively COX1 translation and is involved in MSS51 association with newly synthesized COX1. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16510898, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19751518, ECO:0000269|PubMed:20876281, ECO:0000269|PubMed:21068384}.

Entry.Name: TFB5_YEAST
Protein.names: General transcription and DNA repair factor IIH subunit TFB5 (TFIIH subunit TFB5) (RNA polymerase II transcription factor B subunit 5)
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the general transcription and DNA repair factor IIH (TFIIH) core complex, which is involved in general and transcription-coupled nucleotide excision repair (NER) of damaged DNA and, when complexed to TFIIK, in RNA transcription by RNA polymerase II. In NER, TFIIH acts by opening DNA around the lesion to allow the excision of the damaged oligonucleotide and its replacement by a new DNA fragment. In transcription, TFIIH has an essential role in transcription initiation. When the pre-initiation complex (PIC) has been established, TFIIH is required for promoter opening and promoter escape. Phosphorylation of the C-terminal tail (CTD) of the largest subunit of RNA polymerase II by the kinase module TFIIK controls the initiation of transcription. TFB5 is required for stable recruitment of TFIIH to a promoter, but not for stability of TFIIH subunits. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:7961739, ECO:0000269|PubMed:8631896}.

Entry.Name: RS22B_YEAST
Protein.names: Small ribosomal subunit protein uS8B (40S ribosomal protein S22-B) (RP50) (S24) (YP58) (YS22)
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the ribosome, a large ribonucleoprotein complex responsible for the synthesis of proteins in the cell. The small ribosomal subunit (SSU) binds messenger RNAs (mRNAs) and translates the encoded message by selecting cognate aminoacyl-transfer RNA (tRNA) molecules. The large subunit (LSU) contains the ribosomal catalytic site termed the peptidyl transferase center (PTC), which catalyzes the formation of peptide bonds, thereby polymerizing the amino acids delivered by tRNAs into a polypeptide chain. The nascent polypeptides leave the ribosome through a tunnel in the LSU and interact with protein factors that function in enzymatic processing, targeting, and the membrane insertion of nascent chains at the exit of the ribosomal tunnel. {ECO:0000305|PubMed:22096102}.

Entry.Name: NBL1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the aurora kinase complex, also called chromosomal passenger complex (CPC), essential for chromosome segregation and metaphase chromosome alignment. Mediates the SLI15-BIR1 interaction within the CPC. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19158380}.

Entry.Name: LSO1_YEAST
Protein.names: Protein LSO1 (Late-annotated small open reading frame 1)
Functions: FUNCTION: Likely to play a role in iron homeostasis. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:26450372}.

Entry.Name: CENPX_YEAST
Protein.names: Inner kinetochore subunit MHF2 (CENP-X homolog) (Constitutive centromere-associated network protein MHF2) (MHF histone-fold complex subunit 2) (MPH1-associated histone-fold protein 2)
Functions: FUNCTION: DNA-binding component of a FANCM-MHF complex involved in DNA damage repair and genome maintenance (PubMed:20347428). FANCM-MHF promotes gene conversion at blocked replication forks, probably by reversal of the stalled fork (By similarity). Component of the kinetochore, a multiprotein complex that assembles on centromeric DNA and attaches chromosomes to spindle microtubules, mediating chromosome segregation and sister chromatid segregation during meiosis and mitosis. Component of the inner kinetochore constitutive centromere-associated network (CCAN), which serves as a structural platform for outer kinetochore assembly (PubMed:22561346). {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:O74896, ECO:0000269|PubMed:20347428, ECO:0000269|PubMed:22561346}.

Entry.Name: PCC1_YEAST
Protein.names: EKC/KEOPS complex subunit PCC1 (Polarized growth chromatin-associated controller 1)
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the EKC/KEOPS complex that is required for the formation of a threonylcarbamoyl group on adenosine at position 37 (t(6)A37) in tRNAs that read codons beginning with adenine. The complex is probably involved in the transfer of the threonylcarbamoyl moiety of threonylcarbamoyl-AMP (TC-AMP) to the N6 group of A37. PCC1 functions as a dimerization module for the complex. The EKC/KEOPS complex also promotes both telomere uncapping and telomere elongation. The complex is required for efficient recruitment of transcriptional coactivators. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16874308, ECO:0000269|PubMed:21183954, ECO:0000269|PubMed:21459853, ECO:0000269|PubMed:23258706, ECO:0000269|PubMed:23620299}.

Entry.Name: YOS1_YEAST
Protein.names: Protein transport protein YOS1 (YIP one suppressor protein 1)
Functions: FUNCTION: Required for protein transport between endoplasmic reticulum and Golgi apparatus. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15659647}.

Entry.Name: CENPS_YEAST
Protein.names: Inner kinetochore subunit MHF1 (CENP-S homolog) (Constitutive centromere-associated network protein MHF1) (MHF histone-fold complex subunit 1) (MPH1-associated histone-fold protein 1)
Functions: FUNCTION: dsDNA-binding component of a FANCM-MHF complex involved in DNA damage repair and genome maintenance (PubMed:20347428). FANCM-MHF promotes gene conversion at blocked replication forks, probably by reversal of the stalled fork (By similarity). Component of the kinetochore, a multiprotein complex that assembles on centromeric DNA and attaches chromosomes to spindle microtubules, mediating chromosome segregation and sister chromatid segregation during meiosis and mitosis. Component of the inner kinetochore constitutive centromere-associated network (CCAN), which serves as a structural platform for outer kinetochore assembly (PubMed:22561346). {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:O74896, ECO:0000269|PubMed:20347428, ECO:0000269|PubMed:22561346}.

Entry.Name: ISD11_YEAST
Protein.names: Protein ISD11 (Iron-sulfur protein biogenesis, desulfurase-interacting protein 11)
Functions: FUNCTION: Required for mitochondrial iron-sulfur proteins biosynthesis. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16341090}.

Entry.Name: SCS22_YEAST
Protein.names: Vesicle-associated membrane protein-associated protein SCS22 (VAMP-associated protein SCS22) (VAP homolog 2)
Functions: FUNCTION: Targets proteins containing a FFAT motif to membranes (By similarity). Involved in regulation of phospholipid metabolism. {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15668246}.

Entry.Name: KISH_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in the early part of the secretory pathway. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19942856}.

Entry.Name: HSH49_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Possible SF3b-like factor.

Entry.Name: AP2M_YEAST
Protein.names: AP-2 complex subunit mu (Adaptin medium chain APM4) (Clathrin assembly protein complex 2 mu medium chain) (Clathrin coat assembly protein AP50) (Clathrin coat-associated protein AP50) (Mu2-adaptin) (Plasma membrane adaptor AP-2 50 kDa protein)
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the adaptor complexes which link clathrin to receptors in coated vesicles. Clathrin-associated protein complexes are believed to interact with the cytoplasmic tails of membrane proteins, leading to their selection and concentration. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10564262}.

Entry.Name: RGS2_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: GTPase activating protein for GPA2. Negatively down-regulates glucose-induced cAMP signaling via GPA2. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10523302}.

Entry.Name: MTR10_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in mRNA transport from nucleus to cytoplasm.

Entry.Name: DET1_YEAST
Protein.names: Broad-range acid phosphatase DET1 (EC 3.1.3.-) (Decreased ergosterol transport protein 1)
Functions: FUNCTION: Metal-independent, broad-range acid phosphatase. Involved, either directly or indirectly, in the bidirectional transport of sterols between the endoplasmic reticulum and the plasma membrane. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19060182, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19753119}.

Entry.Name: ODC2_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Transports C5-C7 oxodicarboxylates across the inner membranes of mitochondria. Can transport 2-oxoadipate, 2-oxoglutarate, adipate, glutarate, 2-oxopimelate, oxaloacetate, citrate and malate. The main physiological role is probably to supply 2-oxoadipate and 2-oxoglutarate from the mitochondrial matrix to the cytosol where they are used in the biosynthesis of lysine and glutamate, respectively, and in lysine catabolism.

Entry.Name: MPD2_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Non essential disulfide isomerase, which participates in the folding of proteins containing disulfide bonds. May be involved in glycosylation, prolyl hydroxylation and triglyceride transfer. Able to fold proteins by being directly oxidized by ERO1. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:9367834}.

Entry.Name: HPH1_YEAST
Protein.names: Protein HPH1 (Functionally related to TCP1 protein 1) (High pH protein 1)
Functions: FUNCTION: Calcineurin-dependent protein required for growth under high NaCl, alkaline pH and cell wall stress. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15189990}.

Entry.Name: UBA3_YEAST
Protein.names: NEDD8-activating enzyme E1 catalytic subunit (EC 6.2.1.64) (RUB1-activating enzyme E1) (Ubiquitin-activating enzyme E1 3) (Ubiquitin-like protein-activating enzyme)
Functions: FUNCTION: Catalytic subunit of the dimeric UBA3-ULA1 E1 enzyme. E1 activates NEDD8/RUB1 by first adenylating its C-terminal glycine residue with ATP, thereafter linking this residue to the side chain of the catalytic cysteine, yielding a NEDD8-UBA3 thioester and free AMP. E1 finally transfers NEDD8 to the catalytic cysteine of UBC12. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:9545234}.

Entry.Name: RAD61_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in resistance to ionizing radiation. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12816519}.

Entry.Name: ENV10_YEAST
Protein.names: SRP-independent targeting protein 2 (Late endosome and vacuole interface protein 10)
Functions: FUNCTION: Functions in the SND pathway, a SRP (signal recognition particle) and GET (guided entry of tail-anchored proteins) independent pathway for targeting a broad range of substrate proteins to the endoplasmic reticulum. SND functions in parallel to GET in targeting proteins with downstream hydrophobic motifs (PubMed:27905431). Involved in vacuolar processing and morphology (PubMed:21912603). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21912603, ECO:0000269|PubMed:27905431}.

Entry.Name: IZH4_YEAST
Protein.names: ADIPOR-like receptor IZH4 (Implicated in zinc homeostasis protein 4)
Functions: FUNCTION: ADIPOR-like receptor involved in zinc metabolism either by altering membrane sterol content or by directly altering cellular zinc levels. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15060275}.

Entry.Name: IGO2_YEAST
Protein.names: mRNA stability protein IGO2 (Initiation of G zero protein 2)
Functions: FUNCTION: Required for TORC1 to properly control gene expression and chronological life span. Plays an essential role in initiation of the G0 program by preventing the degradation of specific nutrient-regulated mRNAs via the 5'-3' mRNA decay pathway. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20471941}.

Entry.Name: TAD3_YEAST
Protein.names: tRNA-specific adenosine deaminase subunit TAD3 (tRNA-specific adenosine-34 deaminase subunit TAD3)
Functions: FUNCTION: Deaminates adenosine-34 to inosine in many tRNAs.

Entry.Name: HTL1_YEAST
Protein.names: High temperature lethal protein 1 (Chromatin structure-remodeling complex protein HTL1)
Functions: FUNCTION: Required for cell cycle progression through G2/M transition at temperatures higher than 33 degrees Celsius. Component of the chromatin structure-remodeling complex (RSC), which is involved in transcription regulation and nucleosome positioning. RSC is responsible for the transfer of a histone octamer from a nucleosome core particle to naked DNA. The reaction requires ATP and involves an activated RSC-nucleosome intermediate. Remodeling reaction also involves DNA translocation, DNA twist and conformational change. As a reconfigurer of centromeric and flanking nucleosomes, RSC complex is required both for proper kinetochore function in chromosome segregation and, via a PKC1-dependent signaling pathway, for organization of the cellular cytoskeleton. When associated with the RSC complex, may act coordinately with PKC1 to regulate G2/M transition. Together with LDB7, NPL6, RSC3, RSC30 components, defines a fungal-specific module within the RSC complex that plays a role in many cellular functions including the maintenance of cell wall integrity. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12417720, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12684875, ECO:0000269|PubMed:16204215}.

Entry.Name: YM084_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in amino sugar synthesis (formation of chitin, supplies the amino sugars of asparagine-linked oligosaccharides of glycoproteins). {ECO:0000250}.

Entry.Name: DIF1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Mediates the nuclear localization of RNR2 and RNR4, 2 subunits of the ribonucleotide reductase. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:18838542, ECO:0000269|PubMed:18851834}.

Entry.Name: YO304_YEAST
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: YD13A_YEAST
Protein.names: Transposon Ty1-DR4 Gag polyprotein (Gag-p49) (Transposon Ty1 protein A) (TY1A) (TYA) (p58) [Cleaved into: Capsid protein (CA) (Gag-p45) (p54); Gag-p4]
Functions: FUNCTION: Capsid protein (CA) is the structural component of the virus-like particle (VLP), forming the shell that encapsulates the retrotransposons dimeric RNA genome. The particles are assembled from trimer-clustered units and there are holes in the capsid shells that allow for the diffusion of macromolecules. CA has also nucleocapsid-like chaperone activity, promoting primer tRNA(i)-Met annealing to the multipartite primer-binding site (PBS), dimerization of Ty1 RNA and initiation of reverse transcription (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.

Entry.Name: HIS1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Catalyzes the condensation of ATP and 5-phosphoribose 1-diphosphate to form N'-(5'-phosphoribosyl)-ATP (PR-ATP). Has a crucial role in the pathway because the rate of histidine biosynthesis seems to be controlled primarily by regulation of the enzymatic activity (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.

Entry.Name: TRPF_YEAST
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: RS17A_YEAST
Protein.names: Small ribosomal subunit protein eS17A (40S ribosomal protein S17-A) (RP51A)
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the ribosome, a large ribonucleoprotein complex responsible for the synthesis of proteins in the cell. The small ribosomal subunit (SSU) binds messenger RNAs (mRNAs) and translates the encoded message by selecting cognate aminoacyl-transfer RNA (tRNA) molecules. The large subunit (LSU) contains the ribosomal catalytic site termed the peptidyl transferase center (PTC), which catalyzes the formation of peptide bonds, thereby polymerizing the amino acids delivered by tRNAs into a polypeptide chain. The nascent polypeptides leave the ribosome through a tunnel in the LSU and interact with protein factors that function in enzymatic processing, targeting, and the membrane insertion of nascent chains at the exit of the ribosomal tunnel. {ECO:0000305|PubMed:22096102}.

Entry.Name: CBP2_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Appears to be specifically required for the splicing of the terminal intron (bI5) of the cytochrome b pre-mRNA. Can also stimulates the splicing of the omega intron of the precursor of large ribosomal RNA.

Entry.Name: AI1M_YEAST
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: AI2M_YEAST
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: SYTC_YEAST
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: HEM4_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Catalyzes cyclization of the linear tetrapyrrole, hydroxymethylbilane, to the macrocyclic uroporphyrinogen III, the fourth step in the heme biosynthetic pathway. {ECO:0000305|PubMed:7597845}.

Entry.Name: HIS8_YEAST
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: SYTM_YEAST
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: CBP1_YEAST
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: PT494_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Required for the expression of the mitochondrial gene for cytochrome c oxidase subunit III (COX3).

Entry.Name: AMYG_YEAST
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: SPS2_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in middle stages of meiosis. Redundant with SPS22 for the organization of the beta-glucan layer of the spore wall. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15590821, ECO:0000269|PubMed:3302678, ECO:0000269|PubMed:7565676}.

Entry.Name: PT111_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Required for translation of the mitochondrial gene for cytochrome c oxidase subunit II (COX2).

Entry.Name: SRD1_YEAST
Protein.names: Pre-rRNA-processing protein SRD1 (Suppressor of rRNA-processing defect protein 1)
Functions: FUNCTION: Plays a direct or indirect role in pre-rRNA processing. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:2179050}.

Entry.Name: SYIC_YEAST
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: HO_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Initiation of mating type interconversion. This protein is a site-specific endonuclease that cleaves a site in the mat locus on chromosome III. The double-strand break is followed by a unidirectional gene conversion event that replaces the information at the mat locus by information copied from either of the two homologous loci (HMR and HML) that reside at the extremity of the chromosome III. Endonuclease expression takes place in late G1 just before cells enter S phase.

Entry.Name: YSF3_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in pre-mRNA splicing. Required for the SF3b integrity and prespliceosome assembly. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16314500}.

Entry.Name: PELS1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Modulates the lysine biosynthesis pathway, possibly by stabilizing the lysine biosynthesis LYS1 protein in lysine-deplete conditions. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:35563734}.

Entry.Name: RL27B_YEAST

Entry.Name: HMAL1_YEAST

Functions: FUNCTION: Mating type proteins are sequence specific DNA-binding proteins that act as master switches in yeast differentiation by controlling gene expression in a cell type-specific fashion. Silenced copy of ALPHA2 at HML.

Entry.Name: RT01_YEAST
Protein.names: Small ribosomal subunit protein mS43 (37S ribosomal protein MRP1, mitochondrial)
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the mitochondrial ribosome (mitoribosome), a dedicated translation machinery responsible for the synthesis of mitochondrial genome-encoded proteins, including at least some of the essential transmembrane subunits of the mitochondrial respiratory chain. The mitoribosomes are attached to the mitochondrial inner membrane and translation products are cotranslationally integrated into the membrane. {ECO:0000305|PubMed:25609543, ECO:0000305|PubMed:28154081}.

Entry.Name: RT02_YEAST
Protein.names: Small ribosomal subunit protein uS14m (37S ribosomal protein MRP2, mitochondrial)
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the mitochondrial ribosome (mitoribosome), a dedicated translation machinery responsible for the synthesis of mitochondrial genome-encoded proteins, including at least some of the essential transmembrane subunits of the mitochondrial respiratory chain. The mitoribosomes are attached to the mitochondrial inner membrane and translation products are cotranslationally integrated into the membrane. {ECO:0000305|PubMed:25609543, ECO:0000305|PubMed:28154081}.

Entry.Name: RS17B_YEAST
Protein.names: Small ribosomal subunit protein eS17B (40S ribosomal protein S17-B) (RP51B)
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the ribosome, a large ribonucleoprotein complex responsible for the synthesis of proteins in the cell. The small ribosomal subunit (SSU) binds messenger RNAs (mRNAs) and translates the encoded message by selecting cognate aminoacyl-transfer RNA (tRNA) molecules. The large subunit (LSU) contains the ribosomal catalytic site termed the peptidyl transferase center (PTC), which catalyzes the formation of peptide bonds, thereby polymerizing the amino acids delivered by tRNAs into a polypeptide chain. The nascent polypeptides leave the ribosome through a tunnel in the LSU and interact with protein factors that function in enzymatic processing, targeting, and the membrane insertion of nascent chains at the exit of the ribosomal tunnel. {ECO:0000305|PubMed:22096102}.

Entry.Name: CBS2_YEAST
Protein.names: Cytochrome B translational activator protein CBS2
Functions: FUNCTION: Translational activator of cytochrome b. The cytochrome b (coB) leader RNA may represent the target sequence for CBS1 and/ or CBS2.

Entry.Name: THRC_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Catalyzes the gamma-elimination of phosphate from L-phosphohomoserine and the beta-addition of water to produce L-threonine. {ECO:0000250}.

Entry.Name: ERD1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Required for the retention of luminal endoplasmic reticulum proteins, affects glycoprotein processing in the Golgi apparatus.

Entry.Name: MER1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Required for chromosome pairing and genetic recombination. MER1 may function to bring the axial elements of the synaptonemal complex corresponding to homologous chromosomes together by initiating recombination. MER1 might be responsible for regulating the MER2 gene and/or gene product.

Entry.Name: OM45_YEAST

Does not arginylate cysteine residues (By similarity). {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000269|PubMed:2185248}.

Entry.Name: SLY41_YEAST

Entry.Name: RPI1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Negative regulator of the Ras-cyclic AMP pathway. Negatively regulate the activity of normal but not mutationally activated Ras proteins. The down-regulatory effect of RPI1 requires the presence of one of the two Ras GTPase activators, IRA1 and IRA2.

Entry.Name: RIT1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: tRNA backbone modifying enzyme that mediates initiator/ elongator tRNA discrimination. This enzyme modifies exclusively the initiator tRNA in position 64 using 5'-phosphoribosyl-1'-pyrophosphate as the modification donor. Recognize the stem-loop IV region that is unique in eukaryotic cytoplasmic initiator tRNAs.

Entry.Name: GPI12_YEAST

Entry.Name: TRX3_YEAST

Entry.Name: YC21A_YEAST
Protein.names: Transposon Ty2-C Gag polyprotein (Transposon Ty2 protein A) (TY2A) (TYA) (Ty1-17 protein A) [Cleaved into: Capsid protein (CA); Gag-p4]
Functions: FUNCTION: Capsid protein (CA) is the structural component of the virus-like particle (VLP), forming the shell that encapsulates the retrotransposons dimeric RNA genome. The particles are assembled from trimer-clustered units and there are holes in the capsid shells that allow for the diffusion of macromolecules. CA has also nucleocapsid-like chaperone activity, promoting primer tRNA(i)-Met annealing to the multipartite primer-binding site (PBS), dimerization of Ty2 RNA and initiation of reverse transcription (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.

Entry.Name: ATG22_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Vacuolar effluxer which mediate the efflux of leucine and other amino acids resulting from autophagic degradation. The release of autophagic amino acids allows the maintenance of protein synthesis and viability during nitrogen starvation. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11058089, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17021250, ECO:0000269|PubMed:8663607}.

Entry.Name: LRE1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Overexpression affects chitinase expression, cell separation and budding pattern, and increases trehalose accumulation and heat resistance by inhibiting protein kinase CBK1. Overexpression also suppresses temperature-induced hyperosmosensitivity and sensitivity to cell wall degrading enzymes. Overexpression of both LRE1 and PBN1 confers resistance to laminarinase. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11532139, ECO:0000269|PubMed:11580836}.

Entry.Name: PEX34_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: In concert with the three peroxisome divisional factors, PEX11, PEX25 and PEX27, controls peroxisome morphology and abundance under conditions of peroxisome proliferation. Maintains mature peroxisomes in actively dividing cells. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21441307}.

Entry.Name: FYV5_YEAST

Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in maintaining an adequate ionic strength homeostasis of the cellular aqueous environment, necessary for normal growth rate. Required for survival upon exposure to K1 killer toxin and hence plays a role in cell wall glucan synthesis. Required for dithiothreitol (DTT) resistance. Involved in cell cycle progression. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10234789, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12663529, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12829295, ECO:0000269|PubMed:16251355}.

Entry.Name: RDS1_YEAST

Entry.Name: HSP30_YEAST

Entry.Name: RM49_YEAST

Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the mitochondrial ribosome (mitoribosome), a dedicated translation machinery responsible for the synthesis of mitochondrial genome-encoded proteins, including at least some of the essential transmembrane subunits of the mitochondrial respiratory chain. The mitoribosomes are attached to the mitochondrial inner membrane and translation products are cotranslationally integrated into the membrane (PubMed:24675956, PubMed:25609543). mL61 is not essential in cells grown at 30 degree Celsius but is required for mitochondrial translation in cells grown at 18 degree Celsius. {ECO:0000305|PubMed:24675956, ECO:0000305|PubMed:25609543}.

It mediates the conjugation process between the two types by inhibiting the initiation of DNA synthesis in type a cells and synchronizing them with type alpha.

Entry.Name: NTF2_YEAST

Functions: FUNCTION: Facilitates protein transport into the nucleus. Interacts with various nucleoporins and with Ran-GDP. Could be part of a multicomponent system of cytosolic factors that assemble at the pore complex during nuclear import. In vitro, the NTF2-Ran-GDP association, in the presence of GTP, triggers dissociation of the karyopherin alpha-beta complex, allowing nuclear translocation of karyopherin alpha and the NLS substrate. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:8600522}.

Entry.Name: SGE1_YEAST

Functions: FUNCTION: Drug export permease. Multi-copy suppressor of loss-of-function mutation of GAL11. Involved specifically in transcription of GAL4-dependent genes. Can link GAL4 with the basal transcription machinery if GAL11 is missing. Confers resistance to 10-N-nonyl acridine orange (NAO) and in general to cationic dyes.

Entry.Name: SPO23_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Regulates expression of PIS1. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15755922}.

Entry.Name: NAT2_YEAST

Entry.Name: RL32_YEAST
Protein.names: Large ribosomal subunit protein eL32 (60S ribosomal protein L32)
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the ribosome, a large ribonucleoprotein complex responsible for the synthesis of proteins in the cell. The small ribosomal subunit (SSU) binds messenger RNAs (mRNAs) and translates the encoded message by selecting cognate aminoacyl-transfer RNA (tRNA) molecules. The large subunit (LSU) contains the ribosomal catalytic site termed the peptidyl transferase center (PTC), which catalyzes the formation of peptide bonds, thereby polymerizing the amino acids delivered by tRNAs into a polypeptide chain. The nascent polypeptides leave the ribosome through a tunnel in the LSU and interact with protein factors that function in enzymatic processing, targeting, and the membrane insertion of nascent chains at the exit of the ribosomal tunnel. {ECO:0000305|PubMed:22096102}.

Entry.Name: RL34B_YEAST
Protein.names: Large ribosomal subunit protein eL34B (60S ribosomal protein L34-B)
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the ribosome, a large ribonucleoprotein complex responsible for the synthesis of proteins in the cell. The small ribosomal subunit (SSU) binds messenger RNAs (mRNAs) and translates the encoded message by selecting cognate aminoacyl-transfer RNA (tRNA) molecules. The large subunit (LSU) contains the ribosomal catalytic site termed the peptidyl transferase center (PTC), which catalyzes the formation of peptide bonds, thereby polymerizing the amino acids delivered by tRNAs into a polypeptide chain. The nascent polypeptides leave the ribosome through a tunnel in the LSU and interact with protein factors that function in enzymatic processing, targeting, and the membrane insertion of nascent chains at the exit of the ribosomal tunnel. {ECO:0000305|PubMed:22096102}.

Entry.Name: AGE2_YEAST

Entry.Name: YKE4_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Zinc transporter whose role depends on the zinc status of the cells. It helps to balance zinc levels between the cytosol and the secretory pathway. It transports zinc into the secretory pathway in a zinc-adequate environment and in a high zinc medium. In high zinc medium, transport of zinc into the secretory pathway is a way to eliminate zinc from the cytosol. Under low cytosolic zinc conditions, it removes zinc from the secretory pathway and acts as zinc importer that helps to alleviate ER stress. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16760462}.

Functions: FUNCTION: Capsid protein (CA) is the structural component of the virus-like particle (VLP), forming the shell that encapsulates the retrotransposons dimeric RNA genome. CA has also nucleocapsid-like chaperone activity, promoting primer tRNA(i)-Met annealing to the multipartite primer-binding site (PBS), dimerization of Ty1 RNA and initiation of reverse transcription (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.

Entry.Name: THI11_YEAST
Protein.names: 4-amino-5-hydroxymethyl-2-methylpyrimidine phosphate synthase THI11 (HMP-P synthase) (Hydroxymethylpyrimidine phosphate synthase) (EC 2.-.-.-) (Thiamine biosynthesis protein 11) (Thiamine pyrimidine synthase)
Functions: FUNCTION: Responsible for the formation of the pyrimidine heterocycle in the thiamine biosynthesis pathway. Catalyzes the formation of hydroxymethylpyrimidine phosphate (HMP-P) from histidine and pyridoxal phosphate (PLP). The protein uses PLP and the active site histidine to form HMP-P, generating an inactive enzyme. The enzyme can only undergo a single turnover, which suggests it is a suicide enzyme. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P43534}.

Entry.Name: RS12_YEAST
Protein.names: Small ribosomal subunit protein eS12 (40S ribosomal protein S12)
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the ribosome, a large ribonucleoprotein complex responsible for the synthesis of proteins in the cell. The small ribosomal subunit (SSU) binds messenger RNAs (mRNAs) and translates the encoded message by selecting cognate aminoacyl-transfer RNA (tRNA) molecules. The large subunit (LSU) contains the ribosomal catalytic site termed the peptidyl transferase center (PTC), which catalyzes the formation of peptide bonds, thereby polymerizing the amino acids delivered by tRNAs into a polypeptide chain. The nascent polypeptides leave the ribosome through a tunnel in the LSU and interact with protein factors that function in enzymatic processing, targeting, and the membrane insertion of nascent chains at the exit of the ribosomal tunnel. {ECO:0000305|PubMed:22096102}.

Entry.Name: FHN1_YEAST
Protein.names: Non-classical export protein 2 homolog 1 (Functional homolog of NCE102)
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in membrane organization. Required for the formation of membrane compartments of CAN1 (MCCs), localization of CAN1 at the MCCs and subsequent invagination of the plasma membrane at the MCCs sites. Involved in eisosome organization and might act as a sensor of sphingolipids that regulates plasma membrane function. Involved in a novel pathway of export of proteins that lack a cleavable signal sequence. Non-classical export pathway functions also as an alternative clearance/detoxification pathway to eliminate damaged material, when the basic repair pathway is not sufficient. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20581291}.

Functions: FUNCTION: The coatomer is a cytosolic protein complex that binds to dilysine motifs and reversibly associates with Golgi non-clathrin-coated vesicles, which further mediate biosynthetic protein transport from the ER, via the Golgi up to the trans Golgi network. The zeta subunit may be involved in regulating the coat assembly and, hence, the rate of biosynthetic protein transport due to its association-dissociation properties with the coatomer complex (PubMed:9058184). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:9058184}.

Entry.Name: RT16_YEAST
Protein.names: Small ribosomal subunit protein bS16m (37S ribosomal protein S16, mitochondrial)
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the mitochondrial ribosome (mitoribosome), a dedicated translation machinery responsible for the synthesis of mitochondrial genome-encoded proteins, including at least some of the essential transmembrane subunits of the mitochondrial respiratory chain. Entry.Name: ECM23_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in morphogenesis. May be involved in cell wall organization and biogenesis. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11889490}.

Entry.Name: PT191_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in the assembly of cytochrome c oxidase.

Entry.Name: OAZ_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Ornithine decarboxylase (ODC) antizyme protein that negatively regulates ODC activity and intracellular polyamine biosynthesis in response to increased intracellular polyamine levels (PubMed:15538383). Binds to ODC/SPE1 monomers, inhibiting the assembly of the functional ODC homodimer, and targets the monomers for ubiquitin-independent proteolytic destruction by the 26S proteasome (PubMed:18089576). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15538383, ECO:0000269|PubMed:18089576}.

Entry.Name: UBP16_YEAST
Protein.names: Ubiquitin carboxyl-terminal hydrolase 16 (EC 3.4.19.12) (Deubiquitinating enzyme 16) (Ubiquitin thioesterase 16) (Ubiquitin-specific-processing protease 16)
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: SYH1_YEAST
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: MGR2_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Required for cell viability in cells lacking mitochondrial DNA. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16267274}.

Entry.Name: YP113_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Putative 2-hydroxyacid dehydrogenase. {ECO:0000250}.

Entry.Name: SPO19_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in sporulation. Essential for completion of the nuclear division. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11101837}.

Entry.Name: MRX11_YEAST

Functions: FUNCTION: Component of MIOREX complexes, large expressome-like assemblies of ribosomes with factors involved in all the steps of post-transcriptional gene expression. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25683707}.

Entry.Name: SRL4_YEAST
Protein.names: Oxidoreductase-like protein SRL4 (Suppressor of RAD53 and LCD1 4) (Suppressor of RAD53 null lethality 4)
Functions: FUNCTION: May be involved in the regulation of dNTP production. Induces the SOS system when expressed in E.coli, therefore, it may play a role in DNA metabolism and/or in genome stability. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10051619}.

Entry.Name: YMN3_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Catalyzes DNA unwinding and is involved in telomerase-independent telomere maintenance. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:9837911}.

Entry.Name: MTG1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Mitochondrial GTPase involved in assembly of the large ribosomal subunit (PubMed:12808030). Plays a role in expression of the mitochondrial translational machinery (PubMed:12808030). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12808030}.

Entry.Name: ATP25_YEAST
Protein.names: ATPase synthesis protein 25, mitochondrial (OLI1 mRNA stabilization factor)
Functions: FUNCTION: mRNA stabilization factor specific for the 0.95 kb OLI1 mRNA. Also involved in OLI1 ring formation. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:18216280}.

Entry.Name: RT10_YEAST

Entry.Name: EAR1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Components of the endosome-vacuole trafficking pathway that regulates nutrient transport. May be involved in processes which determine whether plasma membrane proteins are degraded or routed to the plasma membrane (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.

Entry.Name: MMT1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Mitochondrial metal transporter involved in mitochondrial iron accumulation. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15107423, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9353309}.

Entry.Name: NGL2_YEAST
Protein.names: RNA exonuclease NGL2 (EC 3.1.-.-) (Carbon catabolite repressor protein 4 homolog)
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in pre-rRNA processing. Required for the final stage of 3'-end maturation of 5.8S rRNA at site E. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12358428}.

Entry.Name: PABC_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Converts 4-amino-4-deoxychorismate into 4-aminobenzoate (PABA) and pyruvate. {ECO:0000250}.

Entry.Name: IZH1_YEAST
Protein.names: ADIPOR-like receptor IZH1 (Implicated in zinc homeostasis protein 1)
Functions: FUNCTION: ADIPOR-like receptor involved in zinc metabolism either by altering membrane sterol content or by directly altering cellular zinc levels. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15060275}.

Entry.Name: RMD1_YEAST
Protein.names: Sporulation protein RMD1 (Required for meiotic nuclear division protein 1)
Functions: FUNCTION: Required for sporulation where it is believed to have a role in meiotic nuclear division. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12586695}.

Entry.Name: RCR2_YEAST
Protein.names: Protein RCR2 (Protein SSH5) (Resistance to Congo red protein 2)
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: YD22A_YEAST
Protein.names: Transposon Ty2-DR2 Gag polyprotein (TY2A) (TYA) (Transposon Ty2 protein A) [Cleaved into: Capsid protein (CA); Gag-p4]
Functions: FUNCTION: Capsid protein (CA) is the structural component of the virus-like particle (VLP), forming the shell that encapsulates the retrotransposons dimeric RNA genome. The particles are assembled from trimer-clustered units and there are holes in the capsid shells that allow for the diffusion of macromolecules. CA has also nucleocapsid-like chaperone activity, promoting primer tRNA(i)-Met annealing to the multipartite primer-binding site (PBS), dimerization of Ty2 RNA and initiation of reverse transcription (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.

Entry.Name: RSN1_YEAST
Protein.names: Uncharacterized protein RSN1 (Rescuer of SRO7 at high Nacl protein 1)
Functions: FUNCTION: Acts as an osmosensitive calcium-permeable cation channel. {ECO:0000250}.

Entry.Name: TMA23_YEAST
Protein.names: Protein TMA23 (23 kDa translation machinery-associated protein)
Functions: FUNCTION: Trans-acting factors of the ribosome biogenesis process. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17425675}.

Entry.Name: DML1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in the partitioning of the mitochondrial organelle and mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA) inheritance. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12702300}.

Functions: NA

Functions: FUNCTION: Functions together with the other V-type ATPase assembly factors in the endoplasmic reticulum to efficiently assemble the V-type ATPase membrane sector V(0). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16926153}.

Functions: FUNCTION: Essential protein involved in ribosomal RNA processing.

Functions: FUNCTION: Required for growth under high-pressure and low-temperature conditions. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:18245339}.

Entry.Name: RRB1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in regulation of L3 expression and stability and plays a role in early 60S ribosomal subunit assembly. May be required for proper assembly of pre-ribosomal particles during early ribosome biogenesis, presumably by targeting L3 onto the 35S precursor rRNA.

Entry.Name: GIS4_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: May be involved in the Ras/cAMP signaling pathway. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10628841}.

Functions: NA

Entry.Name: CSI1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the COP9 signalosome (CSN) complex that acts as an regulator of the ubiquitin (Ubl) conjugation pathway by mediating the deneddylation of the cullin subunit of SCF-type E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase complexes The CSN complex is involved in the regulation of the mating pheromone response. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12186635, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12446563}.

Entry.Name: PLM2_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Binds to the promoters of genes with functions important for the G1/S (start) transition; primarily genes involved in DNA synthesis and repair, chromosome segregation, nuclear division and transcription. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12464632}.

Entry.Name: RBA50_YEAST
Protein.names: RNA polymerase II-associated protein RBA50 (RNA polymerase II-associated protein of 50 kDa)
Functions: FUNCTION: Forms an interface between the RNA polymerase II enzyme and chaperone/scaffolding proteins, suggesting that it is required to connect RNA polymerase II to regulators of protein complex formation. {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15282305}.

Entry.Name: HLR1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in cell wall composition and integrity and response to osmotic stress. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11532139, ECO:0000269|PubMed:11580836}.

Entry.Name: YM04_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Sensor of abasic sites in single-stranded DNA (ssDNA) required to preserve genome integrity by promoting error-free repair of abasic sites. Recognizes and binds abasic sites in ssDNA at replication forks and chemically modifies the lesion by forming a covalent cross-link with DNA: forms a stable thiazolidine linkage between a ring-opened abasic site and the alpha-amino and sulfhydryl substituents of its N-terminal catalytic cysteine residue (By similarity). Acts as a protease: mediates autocatalytic processing of its N-terminal methionine in order to expose the catalytic cysteine (By similarity). {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q8R1M0, ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q96FZ2}.

Entry.Name: SHH3_YEAST
Protein.names: Mitochondrial inner membrane protein SHH3 (SDH3 homolog)
Functions: FUNCTION: Homolog of SDH3, but seems not to be a stoichiometric subunit of either the succinate dehydrogenase (SDH) complex or the mitochondrial inner membrane translocase TIM22 complex. {ECO:0000303|PubMed:22152483}.

Entry.Name: AIM33_YEAST

Functions: NA

Entry.Name: YDR09_YEAST

Postulated to function in a metabolite repair mechanism by preventing toxic accumulation of free D-ribulose formed by non-specific phosphatase activities. Alternatively, may play a role in regulating D-ribulose 5-phosphate recycling in the pentose phosphate pathway. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:27909055}.

Functions: FUNCTION: May be involved in cell wall organization and biogenesis.

Functions: NA

IMP catalyzes the removal of signal peptides required for the targeting of proteins from the mitochondrial matrix, across the inner membrane, into the inter-membrane space. SOM1 facilitates cleavage of a subset of IMP substrates. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15254042, ECO:0000269|PubMed:8879245}.

Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in 20S proteasome assembly. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17707236}.

Entry.Name: ECM19_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: May be involved in cell wall organization and biogenesis.

Functions: NA

Functions: NA

Entry.Name: PIG1_YEAST

Functions: NA

Entry.Name: TDA6_YEAST

Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in vacuolar protein sorting. {ECO:0000250}.

Entry.Name: CUR1_YEAST

Entry.Name: YL352_YEAST

Entry.Name: ATG33_YEAST

Entry.Name: THI22_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Is not required for thiamine biosynthesis. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10383756}.

Entry.Name: PLR1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Catalyzes the reduction of pyridoxal (PL) with NADPH and oxidation of pyridoxine (PN) with NADP(+). {ECO:0000250}.

Entry.Name: GPN3_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Small GTPase required for proper nuclear localization of RNA polymerase II and III (RNAPII and RNAPIII). May act at an RNAP assembly step prior to nuclear import (PubMed:23267056). Promotes sister chromatid separation during anaphase (PubMed:23324351). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:23267056, ECO:0000269|PubMed:23324351}.

Entry.Name: SYM1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: May be involved in cellular response to stress. Required to maintain mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA) integrity and stability. Required for ethanol metabolism and tolerance during heat shock. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15189984}.

Entry.Name: ARR2_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in resistance to arsenic compounds. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:9234670}.

Entry.Name: YP174_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Specialized component of the nuclear membrane that may be involved in the connection of the spindle pole body (SPB) to the nuclear envelope. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15282802}.

Entry.Name: GPI11_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Acts in the GPI biosynthetic pathway between GlcNAc-PI synthesis and GPI transfer to protein. Required for the formation of complete GPI precursors CP1 and CP2. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10793139}.

Entry.Name: YD306_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Substrate recognition component of a SCF (SKP1-CUL1-F-box protein) E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase complex which mediates the ubiquitination and subsequent proteasomal degradation of target proteins. Probably recognizes and binds to phosphorylated target proteins (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.

Entry.Name: PMT7_YEAST

Entry.Name: RAD34_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in nucleotide excision repair (NER) of damaged ribosomal DNA (rDNA). Required for the repair of the RNA polymerase I-transcribed strand of rDNA. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15916602}.

Entry.Name: ECM30_YEAST

Entry.Name: RM35_YEAST
Protein.names: Large ribosomal subunit protein mL38 (54S ribosomal protein L35, mitochondrial) (YmL35)
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the mitochondrial ribosome (mitoribosome), a dedicated translation machinery responsible for the synthesis of mitochondrial genome-encoded proteins, including at least some of the essential transmembrane subunits of the mitochondrial respiratory chain. The mitoribosomes are attached to the mitochondrial inner membrane and translation products are cotranslationally integrated into the membrane. {ECO:0000305|PubMed:24675956, ECO:0000305|PubMed:25609543}.

Entry.Name: UBX5_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in CDC48-dependent protein degradation through the ubiquitin/proteasome pathway. {ECO:0000250}.

Entry.Name: CTR3_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Required for high affinity copper (probably reduced Cu I) transport into the cell.

Entry.Name: SRR1L_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in microtubule stability and kinetochore function. May be involved in protein N-terminus acetylation and/or proteasome biogenesis. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:18064466}.

Functions: NA

Entry.Name: MDM36_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in mitochondrial distribution and morphology. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11907266}.

Entry.Name: ASA1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the ASTRA complex involved in chromatin remodeling.

Entry.Name: MRX9_YEAST

Functions: FUNCTION: Component of MIOREX complexes, large expressome-like assemblies of ribosomes with factors involved in all the steps of post-transcriptional gene expression. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25683707}.

Entry.Name: STP4_YEAST
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: PBP4_YEAST
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: MCH1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Probable transporter. Does not act in the transport of monocarboxylic acids across the plasma membrane.

Entry.Name: YET3_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: May play a role in anterograde transport of membrane proteins from the endoplasmic reticulum to the Golgi. May be involved in invertase secretion. {ECO:0000269|Ref.6}.

Entry.Name: RXT3_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the RPD3C(L) histone deacetylase complex (HDAC) responsible for the deacetylation of lysine residues on the N-terminal part of the core histones (H2A, H2B, H3 and H4). Histone deacetylation gives a tag for epigenetic repression and plays an important role in transcriptional regulation, cell cycle progression and developmental events.

Entry.Name: SNA4_YEAST
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: HBT1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Polarity-determining protein which forms a conjugate with the ubiquitin-like modifier HUB1. Involved in bud site selection and cellular morphogenesis during conjugation. Required for survival during stationary phase. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11923536, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15456898}.

Entry.Name: WHI4_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Has a partially redundant function to WHI3, a dosage-dependent modulator of cell size. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11290704}.

Entry.Name: BRE4_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: May be involved in intracellular vesicle transport. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11169758}.

Entry.Name: MFG1_YEAST
Protein.names: Morphogenetic regulator of filamentous growth protein 1
Functions: FUNCTION: Transcriptional regulator with a general role in all morphogenetically distinct forms of filamentous growth, namely haploid invasive growth, biofilm formation, and diploid pseudohyphal growth. May control FLO11 gene expression as part of a promoter-bound complex with FLO8 and MSS1. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22984072}.

Entry.Name: THI13_YEAST
Protein.names: 4-amino-5-hydroxymethyl-2-methylpyrimidine phosphate synthase THI13 (HMP-P synthase) (Hydroxymethylpyrimidine phosphate synthase) (EC 2.-.-.-) (Thiamine biosynthesis protein 13) (Thiamine pyrimidine synthase)
Functions: FUNCTION: Responsible for the formation of the pyrimidine heterocycle in the thiamine biosynthesis pathway. Catalyzes the formation of hydroxymethylpyrimidine phosphate (HMP-P) from histidine and pyridoxal phosphate (PLP). The protein uses PLP and the active site histidine to form HMP-P, generating an inactive enzyme. The enzyme can only undergo a single turnover, which suggests it is a suicide enzyme. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P43534}.

Entry.Name: DHSO2_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Polyol dehydrogenase that catalyzes the reversible NAD(+)-dependent oxidation of various sugar alcohols. Is active with D-sorbitol (D-glucitol) and xylitol as substrates, leading to the C2-oxidized product D-fructose and D-xylulose, respectively. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P35497}.

Entry.Name: COS7_YEAST
Functions: NA

Entry.Name: SPO75_YEAST

Entry.Name: IRC19_YEAST

Entry.Name: ENT4_YEAST

Entry.Name: THI73_YEAST

Acts to bind and sequester a-factor rather than to degrade it, and promotes the efficient mating of MATalpha cells by keeping the a-factor concentration at the plasma membrane within the narrow range needed for accurate pheromone gradient detection (Probable). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24121774, ECO:0000305|PubMed:24121774}.

Functions: NA

Entry.Name: INP54_YEAST

Does not utilize phosphatidylinositol 3,5-bisphosphate (PtdIns(3,5)P2), nor phosphatidylinositol 3-phosphate (PtdIns(3)P) and phosphatidylinositol 4-phosphate (PtdIns(4)P). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10660045, ECO:0000269|PubMed:11116155}.

Component of the APT complex, which may be involved in polyadenylation-independent transcript 3'-end formation, including snoRNAs and snRNAs.

Entry.Name: SSP2_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Essential for sporulation and seems to have a role at the time of, or after, initiation of nuclear division. Appears to have a role in outer spore wall formation. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12073037}.

Functions: FUNCTION: Transfers the 4'-phosphopantetheine moiety from coenzyme A to a Ser of mitochondrial acyl-carrier-protein. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:9712852}.

Entry.Name: PIN2_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Not known. Seems to be able to provoque the non-Mendelian trait [PIN(+)] which is required for the de novo appearance of the [PSI(+)] prion.

Entry.Name: ULA1_YEAST
Protein.names: NEDD8-activating enzyme E1 regulatory subunit (E1 N-terminus-related protein 2) (Ubiquitin-activating enzyme E1-like 1) (Ubiquitin-like activation protein 1)
Functions: FUNCTION: Regulatory subunit of the dimeric UBA3-ULA1 E1 enzyme. E1 activates NEDD8/RUB1 by first adenylating its C-terminal glycine residue with ATP, thereafter linking this residue to the side chain of the catalytic cysteine, yielding a NEDD8-UBA3 thioester and free AMP. E1 finally transfers NEDD8 to the catalytic cysteine of UBC12. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:9531531, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9545234}.

Entry.Name: YG11A_YEAST
Protein.names: Transposon Ty1-GR1 Gag polyprotein (Gag-p49) (Transposon Ty1 protein A) (TY1A) (TYA) (p58) [Cleaved into: Capsid protein (CA) (Gag-p45) (p54); Gag-p4]
Functions: FUNCTION: Capsid protein (CA) is the structural component of the virus-like particle (VLP), forming the shell that encapsulates the retrotransposons dimeric RNA genome. The particles are assembled from trimer-clustered units and there are holes in the capsid shells that allow for the diffusion of macromolecules. CA has also nucleocapsid-like chaperone activity, promoting primer tRNA(i)-Met annealing to the multipartite primer-binding site (PBS), dimerization of Ty1 RNA and initiation of reverse transcription (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.

Entry.Name: AEP3_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Required for respiration. Stabilizes the mitochondrial bicistronic mRNA encoding ATP6 and ATP8, 2 subunits of the proton-translocating ATP synthase. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:14742425}.

RHO1 is a key, essential hub protein in the cell wall integrity (CWI) pathway in which activated RHO1-GTP binds directly to and activates multiple different downstream effectors required for cell wall synthesis and actin assembly during cytokinesis (Probable). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22344253, ECO:0000305|PubMed:22344253}.

Entry.Name: PRPD_YEAST

Entry.Name: ZRT2_YEAST
Protein.names: Zinc-regulated transporter 2 (Low-affinity zinc transport protein ZRT2)
Functions: FUNCTION: Low-affinity zinc transport protein. Active in zinc-replete cells and is time-, temperature- and concentration-dependent and prefers zinc over other metals as its substrate. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:8798516}.

Entry.Name: YO21A_YEAST
Protein.names: Transposon Ty2-OR1 Gag polyprotein (TY2A) (TYA) (Transposon Ty2 protein A) [Cleaved into: Capsid protein (CA); Gag-p4]
Functions: FUNCTION: Capsid protein (CA) is the structural component of the virus-like particle (VLP), forming the shell that encapsulates the retrotransposons dimeric RNA genome. The particles are assembled from trimer-clustered units and there are holes in the capsid shells that allow for the diffusion of macromolecules. CA has also nucleocapsid-like chaperone activity, promoting primer tRNA(i)-Met annealing to the multipartite primer-binding site (PBS), dimerization of Ty2 RNA and initiation of reverse transcription (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.

Entry.Name: SET6_YEAST

Functions: FUNCTION: Involved in resistance to compounds that target ergosterol biosynthesis, including fenpropimorph, dyclonine, and alverine citrate. Since a deletion in the absence of these compounds does not have an effect on growth, is more likely to be involved in compound availability. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:14718668}.

Entry.Name: RL21B_YEAST
Protein.names: Large ribosomal subunit protein eL21B (60S ribosomal protein L21-B)
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the ribosome, a large ribonucleoprotein complex responsible for the synthesis of proteins in the cell. The small ribosomal subunit (SSU) binds messenger RNAs (mRNAs) and translates the encoded message by selecting cognate aminoacyl-transfer RNA (tRNA) molecules. The large subunit (LSU) contains the ribosomal catalytic site termed the peptidyl transferase center (PTC), which catalyzes the formation of peptide bonds, thereby polymerizing the amino acids delivered by tRNAs into a polypeptide chain. The nascent polypeptides leave the ribosome through a tunnel in the LSU and interact with protein factors that function in enzymatic processing, targeting, and the membrane insertion of nascent chains at the exit of the ribosomal tunnel. {ECO:0000305|PubMed:22096102}.

Entry.Name: RL13A_YEAST
Protein.names: Large ribosomal subunit protein eL13A (60S ribosomal protein L13-A)
Functions: FUNCTION: Component of the ribosome, a large ribonucleoprotein complex responsible for the synthesis of proteins in the cell. The small ribosomal subunit (SSU) binds messenger RNAs (mRNAs) and translates the encoded message by selecting cognate aminoacyl-transfer RNA (tRNA) molecules. The large subunit (LSU) contains the ribosomal catalytic site termed the peptidyl transferase center (PTC), which catalyzes the formation of peptide bonds, thereby polymerizing the amino acids delivered by tRNAs into a polypeptide chain. The nascent polypeptides leave the ribosome through a tunnel in the LSU and interact with protein factors that function in enzymatic processing, targeting, and the membrane insertion of nascent chains at the exit of the ribosomal tunnel. {ECO:0000305|PubMed:22096102}.

Entry.Name: YKD3A_YEAST

Entry.Name: AAP_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Arginine attenuator peptide (AAP) that has a regulatory role in the production of arginine-specific carbamoyl phosphate synthetase. Encoded by an upstream open reading frame (uORF) within the 5'-leader region of arginine-specific carbamoyl phosphate synthetase small chain (CPA1) mRNA, it attenuates the translation of the downstream CPA1 ORF. In the presence of high concentrations of arginine, ribosomes translating the uORF encoding AAP stall at the termination codon, resulting in reduced translation from the downstream CPA1 initiation codon. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10608810, ECO:0000269|PubMed:11057443, ECO:0000269|PubMed:3555844}.

Entry.Name: GPG1_YEAST
Protein.names: Heterotrimeric G protein gamma subunit GPG1
Functions: FUNCTION: Gamma subunit of a guanine nucleotide-binding protein (G protein). G proteins are involved as modulators or transducers in various transmembrane signaling systems. The beta and gamma chains are required for the GTPase activity, for replacement of GDP by GTP, and for G protein-effector interaction. Involved in the determination of the cAMP level according to nutritional conditions, most probably as a regulator of cAMP phosphodiesterase. Required for the control of pseudohyphal and haploid invasive growth. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12150916}.

Entry.Name: AYT1_YEAST
Functions: FUNCTION: Trichothecene 3-O-acetyltransferase involved in self-protection against trichothecenes, mycotoxins acting as eukaryotic protein synthesis inhibitors. Its existence is surprising in a non-trichothecene producer organism which needs no self-protection again endogenic trichothecenes. The persistence of this non-essential gene may be due to a selective advantage that it may confer, like a resistance to exogenic trichothecenes. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12478589, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15699200}.
